671986861.name: perfect picnic spot
671986861.author: a TripAdvisor user
671986861.reviewBody:
I've been here many times since I was little. It's a perfect place to go on a date or to take your family to have a nice picnic day. kids can run around and play on the grass, teens can enjoy playing a board game ( bring your own)  or observing the trees and listening to the birds.
Once my friends and I had a picnic and played twister, it was really fun.
The entrance is really cheap and you can get a student discount.
They sell some plants and delicious ice lollipops <3 
just don't forget to take with you a mosquito repellent lotion or something like that.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Antigua a Coatepec No. 351 Km 2.5

669989984.name: A most visit Botanical Garden in Xalapa
669989984.author: a TripAdvisor user
669989984.reviewBody: The Botanical Garden is a place nobody can miss when visiting Xalapa, it is out of town, about 20 min by car, a taxi should charge you around 80 pesos from downtown Xalapa. There is place called \u201cThe monument\u201d from there you can take a pool taxi and pay 25 pesos, there is also a bus from that location but no schedule is available. The Garden is quite large, bring water and a hat, some food would be nice too. There is a cafeteria, it is good, but quite small and can get crowded if you   go there at lunch time that in Mexico can go from 12:00-14:00. You could easily spend 3-4 hours just walking around the beautiful place.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Antigua a Coatepec No. 351 Km 2.5

621311365.name: A must when visiting the Xalapa-Coatepec-Xico region
621311365.author: a TripAdvisor user
621311365.reviewBody: This is a wonderful place. There\'s no map, one just floats around and discovers amazing bambus, trees, habitats

address.streetAddress: Carretera Antigua a Coatepec No. 351 Km 2.5

610696529.name: A nice short drive from the city
610696529.author: a TripAdvisor user
610696529.reviewBody: Some incredible giant trees. A well laid out garden and well worth the visit. Not expensive by taxi which are frequently passing the entrance gates, so it\'s only a short wait to hail one for the return journey back to the city.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Antigua a Coatepec No. 351 Km 2.5

564145932.name: Spend a wonderful day visiting this well planned garden
564145932.author: a TripAdvisor user
564145932.reviewBody: During my 45 years living in Xalapa, Veracruz the Jardin Botanico is one of the most outstanding acheivments that I have seen realized here. The Jardin is the showroom of the Ecological Institute were we can go to learn so much about the natural enviornment that surrounds us, from exotic plants to sustainable gardening. There are constantly classes and events where one can participate for free or a very small fee to learn about orchids, bamboo, trees, butterflies, and a miriad of other subjects. I just wish I had more time to participate! The Jardin is only about 10 to 15 minutes from downtown Xalapa, depending on traffic, through lush vegetation on the curving old road to the Magic Village of Coatepec. As well as the Anthropology Museum of Xalapa, the Jardin is a must visit well worth your time. \u00a1Hasta pronto, amigos!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Antigua a Coatepec No. 351 Km 2.5

561811517.name: good collection of pony tailed palms.
561811517.author: a TripAdvisor user
561811517.reviewBody: The collections are well maintained and organized.  For bird watching it is best to arrive at opening (9:00 am).  Mondays are closed.   There are trails through older growth cloud forest that are full of birds.  We arrived on the Briones bus from Coatepec.  The bus runs through a beautiful backroad, and it is well worth the time to take it.  Plan for about 2 hours in the garden which also gives plenty of time to relax in this serene place.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Antigua a Coatepec No. 351 Km 2.5

478608878.name: Excellent garden
478608878.author: a TripAdvisor user
478608878.reviewBody: The botanical garden offers a great example of orchids, mountain rain forest, regional edibles and herbs, collection of bambues, collection of ginkgo biloba, collection of cactus

address.streetAddress: Carretera Antigua a Coatepec No. 351 Km 2.5

447935018.name: One of the best botanical gardens in Mexico!
447935018.author: a TripAdvisor user
447935018.reviewBody: This site is not only beautiful and is a great place for family activities (like picnics), but it gathers an awesome collection of plants, including cycads, carnivorous plants, etc.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Antigua a Coatepec No. 351 Km 2.5

446774141.name: Fun
446774141.author: a TripAdvisor user
446774141.reviewBody: Very beautiful. Enjoyed seeing the beautiful herbs and nature. This was easy to get to and we had an excellent time.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Antigua a Coatepec No. 351 Km 2.5

417581844.name: Educational
417581844.author: a TripAdvisor user
417581844.reviewBody: The garden exposes you to so many plants. I was able to learn so much about Mexico\'s biodiversity in a short visit.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Antigua a Coatepec No. 351 Km 2.5

674982796.name: Travel on time
674982796.author: a TripAdvisor user
674982796.reviewBody: It transport you to a different epoch, in the money you step inside of the big halls you feel the smell of the past, all the culture and heritage of our beautiful Mexico and the footprint of our historical figures comes to life. \nAmazing Been gardens and peaceful walking spaces.

668285792.name: Great piece of history
668285792.author: a TripAdvisor user
668285792.reviewBody: Located in a beautifully lush area this old Hacienda is a very traditional colonial Spanish style common to Mexico. Built by one of Cortez\u2019 soldiers and later taken over by President Santa Ana (who sold California and more to the US) this old Hacienda is well preserved and the furnishings overall are in good shape. It is a piece of history well preserved and worth the visit.

658178376.name: WHAT A PLACE!
658178376.author: a TripAdvisor user
658178376.reviewBody: Personally,I love historical places, and everything about this is so magical. You can\'t do a lot of things here, but you can take such beautiful pictures! The place is really big, and I highly recommend you to ask for a guide, they have a voluntary payment as cost, but they know a lot and can tell you about the items there and about everything that once happened at the big house!

609593814.name: La Hacienda
609593814.author: a TripAdvisor user
609593814.reviewBody: Disfrutamos de una visita por la tarde a La Hacienda. Es un lugar hermoso con una rica historia y maravillosa arquitecture.\n\nWe enjoyed an afternoon visit to La Hacienda. It is a beautiful place with a rich history and wonderful architecture.

565944511.name: My favorite place for taking wedding pictures!
565944511.author: a TripAdvisor user
565944511.reviewBody: This incredible hacienda belonged in the late 1840\'s to Antonio L\u00f3pez de Santa Ana, the infamous 11 time president of M\u00e9xico born in Xalapa and the battle of the Alamo in Texas, was my favorite place to take wedding portraits during my 35 years as a professional studio photographer here in Xalapa. Plan at least half a day to visit the hacienda museum, taking a guided tour with the several guides who will be happy to show your this historically rich part of Mexico\'s past. The chapel was built by Santa Ana to celebrate his wedding to his young and whimsical bride, with a very unusual facade for a mexican church. The main house is furnished with period furniture, so a guide is really important to find out what history is behind all of the unique furniture.\nTry and read-up about the hacienda before going so that your visit will be more fruitful. The interior garden has a gigantic "higuera" tree where supposedly Santa Ana held many cock fights for the wealthy mexican hacendados and military, often times leading to the loss of fortunes. The view to the east from the hacienda can be spectacular, especially at night when you can see the lights of Veracruz port which is almost an hour away. There are very good restaurants in the nearby town of Miradores on the way to Veracruz city. Enjoy your visit!

496352399.name: Historic Gem
496352399.author: a TripAdvisor user
496352399.reviewBody: If you are interested in Mexican history, this is a must-see attraction. The place is named after its first occupant, Juan Lencero, who was a soldier under the command of the Spanish Conquistador Hernan Cortez. It was later the home of the infamous Mexican president, Antonio Lopez de Santa Ana. Well preserved and furnished, it is really like stepping back in time. The buildings and structures are well maintained and the grounds are beautiful.

454164500.name: Who knew?
454164500.author: a TripAdvisor user
454164500.reviewBody: This hacienda was given by Fernano Cortz to one of his lutenists during the 1500\'s.  It is remarkably refined for the era and is filled with expensive European furniture that I did not expect..

438054849.name: beautiful old home and grounds
438054849.author: a TripAdvisor user
438054849.reviewBody: The old Santa Ana home is definitely worth a visit. It is very well maintained and has many period pieces (furniture) from the 1800\'s. The grounds are fabulous and very well maintained.

367522000.name: Very beautiful Hacienda!
367522000.author: a TripAdvisor user
367522000.reviewBody: It is a very beautiful place and will make you feel like you have stepped back in time.  Make sure to give yourself plenty of time to take your time and enjoy the place.  I would say three- four hours for sure..  It\'s just too bad that Santana sold the small piece of Mexico to the USA for a large sum of money and pocketed it all for himself...

326763274.name: Great site 7 kilometers east of Xalapa
326763274.author: a TripAdvisor user
326763274.reviewBody: We had a stellar guide who recommended this amazing hacienda with a 500 year old history. The hacienda and the grounds are remarkable. Be sure you have a knowledgeable guide with you if you decide to visit.

282245121.name: very nice place!
282245121.author: a TripAdvisor user
282245121.reviewBody: I like the view and how the preserve the place, very nice to see the old furniture and imagine how those people lived at that time

260066919.name: Historic, Interesting Exhibit and wonderful Landscape
260066919.author: a TripAdvisor user
260066919.reviewBody: Merging of a historic with a nice walking place to enjoy a very well preserved Hacienda in el Lencero community near Xalapa, with beautiful landscapes, local flora and historic construction built for a not very popular Mexican President but interesting exhibition from XIX Century embedded in the forest with old trees and beautiful flowers. Despite the fact is close to Xalapa, the route symbols and directions are not very easy to follow. Also it would be great to have a larger menu in the coffee shop to extend the time of the visit, since it is a very nice place to relax too.

242228107.name: Grat condition and exhibit
242228107.author: a TripAdvisor user
242228107.reviewBody: This Hacienda is famous for being owned by Antonio de Santa Ana, who was President of Mexico in many ocassions.  It is very well maintained and with furniture from the XIX century.  Beautiful gardens and very nice church.

221694793.name: Charming hacienda
221694793.author: a TripAdvisor user
221694793.reviewBody: I wasn\'t very excited about the prospect of visiting this place after reading the reviews here, but I\'m very glad I went. The history is far more interesting than the furniture (in my opinion) and the place itself is charming: an enormous tree, lots of butterflies, gardens, a huge spring-fed pool, beautiful house, lovely chapel, etc.

214734202.name: Beautiful Hacienda
214734202.author: a TripAdvisor user
214734202.reviewBody: It is a well preserved hacienda, with some history to it, it is about 15 minute drive outside Xalapa,, it is not a must see, but if you have the chance, we stopped on our way back to Veracruz it was worth it.

180199944.name: Great piece of history close to Xalapa
180199944.author: a TripAdvisor user
180199944.reviewBody: This is a very beautiful and well-preserved property. General Santa Anna used to own it when it was a little over 44,000 acres big. Nowadays only the Hacienda, chapel and dam remain. There are tourist guides on the property that will fill you in on all the history at no cost. It\'s a nice place to look at how people lived a long time ago, and great place for photograph aficionados. Nice place to spend an afternoon.

174184069.name: General Santa Anna hideaway for his 16 year old wife
174184069.author: a TripAdvisor user
174184069.reviewBody: General Santa Anna purchased this property while wooing a 16 year old to be his new wife.  He had the wedding in the chapel on the property.  That was all the info we got while touring this property.  He apparently was a real estate speculator as this is only one of a number of homes he purchased and sold.  The property has only a bed that was supposedly used by the General, everything else is just old furniture collected by the museum to fill the rooms.  If you have absolutely nothing to do its worth coming to see the 500 year old tree on the property otherwise its just a waste of time.

164898327.name: A little more information would have made it much more interesting
164898327.author: a TripAdvisor user
164898327.reviewBody: This is a well-restored hacienda, but there is no information about the site. One of the attendants told us a little, including the fact that General Santa Anna lived there for a while, but it was not in the house that is open for touring. The giant 500-year old tree is impressive and the grounds are pretty. As we were leaving, I asked why there was no information, and the ticket taker said that they have a flyer but it\'s 5 pesos! I bought one anyway, and although it is all in Spanish, it was helpful to understand what we had seen. None of the furniture is from the place, although it is from the era. It was a pleasant place to walk around, but not that special.

143880491.name: Another mansion
143880491.author: a TripAdvisor user
143880491.reviewBody: Its a nice old house and garden, but in the end it\'s another mansion populated with era pieces rather than originals except one bed.  There\'s no signage -- and certainly nothing in English.

137761435.name: Worth a Visit
137761435.author: a TripAdvisor user
137761435.reviewBody: The hacienda, church, and gardens are beautiful and very well maintained.  However the tour guide and the tour itself leave something to be desired.  The guide, an attractive, well-dressed young woman, seemed bored and delivered her memorized script in an automaton\'s monotone.  Also, when you visit the hacienda where Santa Anna lived, you expect to get some sense of that larger-than-life character and his life.  But you don\'t.  Unfortunately Santa Anna has been used as a scapegoat in Mexican history, and he is not credited with the good he accomplished.  There was bad too, but it seems strange that he has become a non-person in the country which he fought to defend when his compatriots did little.\nAnother complaint I have is that visitors must view most of the rooms from outside, through the doorways.  I think it would be possible to rope off some space inside most of the rooms so people can enter.  Most of those touring the house have to stand outside while the guide makes her comments, and it is difficult to associate what she has said with the things in the room when you finally get to poke your head in.\nIn spite of my reservations, I do recommend a visit to El Lencero for an interesting peek into the past.

132436438.name: A nice day-trip
132436438.author: a TripAdvisor user
132436438.reviewBody: The site is very pretty and quite well maintained, essentially an old haciendo owned once by former president Santa Ana. Its not uniquely pretty or special but makes for a nice trip into the countryside

125670780.name: A jewel in Xalapa\'s crown!
125670780.author: a TripAdvisor user
125670780.reviewBody: Excellent, a real Jewel.....beautiful location, beautiful buildings and beautiful gardens!  It doesn\'t get the 5 stars as parking can be sparse on busy days (which however, to be fair, is rare). If you are visiting circa Xalapa this is a must.

124615922.name: Enjoyable, if you have time to spare
124615922.author: a TripAdvisor user
124615922.reviewBody: I especially enjoyed the villa\'s setting, gardens, pond. And the wondering hens in the courtyard. The furniture is neither the original one nor particularly attractive. Also, most rooms can only be seen from the outside, rendering the experience somewhat remote and unemotional.

120442132.name: Beautiful hacienda with antique furniture
120442132.author: a TripAdvisor user
120442132.reviewBody: Even if you don\'t have a car, find a taxi (about 12km south east of the center) and don\'t miss this ex-hacienda turned museum. It is a beautiful mansion where all the rooms have kept antique/original furniture and showing also the kitchen and old horse-pulled cars. The guide is included in the entrance fee.\nThe gardens are well kept with a ginormous old fig tree.

666101874.name: Lush Park
666101874.author: a TripAdvisor user
666101874.reviewBody: One of the few lush parks in Mexico.  A stream flows through it and due to Xalapas climate this park has a closed canopy.  The park is also covered in moss.  How often do you see that in Mexico?!

650111261.name: Awesome spot to pass by
650111261.author: a TripAdvisor user
650111261.reviewBody: Very interesting little park that we are so glad we decided to walk through. The whole park is a fountain running from top to a coiled stream at the very bottom. Tons of nature and beautiful landscaping right in the middle of the city. It\u2019s like a Mexican zen garden \ud83d\ude0a

640912594.name: Very pretty, a lot to offer in a not too overwhelming space
640912594.author: a TripAdvisor user
640912594.reviewBody: Large enough to spend the afternoon, small enough to jot get lost. Water and flowers everywhere! Bridges, animals, life. We loved this park, definitely one of Xalapa\'s highlights. Hope to return one of these days.

634838757.name: Very pleasing for a stroll
634838757.author: a TripAdvisor user
634838757.reviewBody: Centrally located, tall trees and fish ponds, perfect for a stroll or sitting for a chat. Small kids seem to have a blast with fountains and looking at fish and turtles.\n\nIt can get louder closer to a high school or a nearby restaurant.

610685657.name: A neat park
610685657.author: a TripAdvisor user
610685657.reviewBody: Good for an hour\'s stroll. Has an outdoor display of 7 raptorson perches on the upper level. Water features and  streams. We went several times to explore the several pathways.

582720014.name: nice walk
582720014.author: a TripAdvisor user
582720014.reviewBody: A very nice, well kept up little park. Not real big so it does not take too much time but is worth it. Went there in the am b4 going to see the big Olmec heads.

575895059.name: Tropical oasis in downtown Xalapa
575895059.author: a TripAdvisor user
575895059.reviewBody: A lush and gorgeous park in central Xalapa. Beautiful flora and fauna, ponds, waterfalls, sculptures, walking trails. It\u2019s not huge but it is a good way to spend an hour as a respite from the hustle and bustle of the city center.

567781960.name: A Treasure in the Center of Xalapa
567781960.author: a TripAdvisor user
567781960.reviewBody: This park appeals to all types of people. Families, singles, sports enthusiast and the like will all enjoy being in this beautiful habitat.

561815912.name: Beautiful serence park amidst a very noisy city
561815912.author: a TripAdvisor user
561815912.reviewBody: We walked in the park for approximately one hour after enjoying a breakfast in the restaurant (same name as the park) that overlooked the park.  The park has raptors and snakes on display, but the many trails, pools, gardens make it a real joy and a must to experience.  Go after breakfast as we did, or bring a lunch and witness the cloud forest up close and personal without safety concerns.

554477320.name: Walk off Lunch and see the turtles
554477320.author: a TripAdvisor user
554477320.reviewBody: Great little park with tons of turtles.  Easy walk but some elevation changes can be challenging.  Great resto nearby and plenty to see into area\n

549798721.name: Very nice park, however, it urgently needs cleanup
549798721.author: a TripAdvisor user
549798721.reviewBody: The park is very nice with many fountains and trees, however,  the whole park is full of leaves of the maple tree so the halls and the fountains do not look as nice as they could be if it was clean.

516483188.name: Magnifico! My favorite park in Xalapa.
516483188.author: a TripAdvisor user
516483188.reviewBody: Gorgeous tropical landscaping and water features. We went early Sunday morning and enjoyed the solitude. An easy walk from  the centro, and a must do. Also, nearby La Estancia restaurant has great food and view of the park.

474415229.name: Beautiful view!
474415229.author: a TripAdvisor user
474415229.reviewBody: This park is perfect to get in touch with nature and relax a bit. Also, if you\'d like to do other activities or bring your kids to play. There are different activities offered such as rappelling, zip line, football courts, and a  small zoo-like area. This is really nice!

460473861.name: Nice place to visit
460473861.author: a TripAdvisor user
460473861.reviewBody: Very nice place to visit with the family, and to do many kinds to exercises, nice park to kids enjoy.

454163673.name: Lovely
454163673.author: a TripAdvisor user
454163673.reviewBody: This was one of the nicest city parks I have ever visited.  It is jungle-like, with many plants and trees.  It also has many pools with very large coi (the large gold fish).  There is also a rafter and snake house, a climbing wall and amitherater as well as a number of man made waterfalls.

446773849.name: Great, kids love it.
446773849.author: a TripAdvisor user
446773849.reviewBody: This park is fun to walk around! On weekends they sometimes offer a free zipline rice, which is very fun! I would recommend for sure!

444735158.name: A hidden gem.
444735158.author: a TripAdvisor user
444735158.reviewBody: What a great find in the middle of the city with lovely nooks and crannies at every turn.  There is also a zip line in the middle of the park.

438053874.name: very beautiful park for a nice stroll.
438053874.author: a TripAdvisor user
438053874.reviewBody: I totally enjoyed walking in this park. There also is a "zoo" with some snakes and birds that had been injured and that they are taking care of. It\'s an oasis in the city

420985753.name: An Excellent park to relax
420985753.author: a TripAdvisor user
420985753.reviewBody: It\'s a very nice place to relax alone or family, where you can see living  big fishes and turtles, ideal to have a nice time.

415811006.name: A beautiful place!
415811006.author: a TripAdvisor user
415811006.reviewBody: This park is right downtown, perfect for a nature stroll after breakfast or while you\'re exploring the centro. It is well-kept and simply beautiful - a great example of the natural beauty that makes Xalapa one of the prettiest cities in Mexico! There are a few areas of the park that are not well-taken care of, but honestly, that\'s to be expected in any place in Veracruz where safety regulations don\'t seem to be a priority.

401121735.name: Beautiful little gem close to the centre od Xalapa
401121735.author: a TripAdvisor user
401121735.reviewBody: Something for everybody here even though it\'s not a massive park, everything is free to see or use, from zip lines to watching the turtles or basketball to walking under giant tree ferns.

396755091.name: A gem
396755091.author: a TripAdvisor user
396755091.reviewBody: Xalapa is a place of incredible plant diversity, microclimates, mountains, water and here a park to showcase it all. The movement of water throughout the park was lovely. Walking/Running trails, play equipment and basketball courts offer something for everyone. Lacking some maintenance but with an original genious in design that plant communities are thriving in their environment. Would love to know who designed this beauty.

393211641.name: Beautiful park
393211641.author: a TripAdvisor user
393211641.reviewBody: Beautiful small hidden park.  Well worth a look-see.  The park is not far from the city center - within walking distance.  I went early in the morning, and I had it all to myself.  Nice walk.

388221722.name: Dreamy retreat
388221722.author: a TripAdvisor user
388221722.reviewBody: Just up the avenue from the bustling town center, you\'ll be enfolded into a tropical marvel of water, fish, turtles and stone work. The restaurant overlooking the gardens is fine, the attached panaderia has the best tiny pan, slightly sweet with cheese and sesame seeds.

387232655.name: Great place to walk
387232655.author: a TripAdvisor user
387232655.reviewBody: It\u00b4s a nice park to walk around with your family or couple. Very green and clean. It has bridges and Kioskos and banks to walk and sit and have a nice time.

297586654.name: Extensive park close to historical center of Xalapa
297586654.author: a TripAdvisor user
297586654.reviewBody: Extensive park close to historical center of Xalapa.\n\nIt is really nice for a walk around and if you are looking for a nice place to eat there is the Estancia de los Tecajetes (I did not go because I was told that the restaurant I am about to mention had a better price point and better food) or the Churrer\u00eda de Xalapa (called de los recuerdos before) which is actually perched above the park on the hill and has really high quality and very well priced regional food with the same great view as the Estancia.

293426891.name: Tranquility not far from city centre
293426891.author: a TripAdvisor user
293426891.reviewBody: I would call it a "forest" rather than a park as there are many tall trees that makes a walk there like one in a tropical rainforest. Nevertheless, there are features of a park like artificial ponds with fish and turtle, and a small house like a mini-zoo where they keep eagles and parrots, which are not as impressive as the trees and vegetations. A walk in the park would be a really soothing experience and a magnificent add-on to your exploration of the historical city.

266623753.name: Fairytale
266623753.author: a TripAdvisor user
266623753.reviewBody: Los Tecajetes park is by far, one of the best parks I have ever been in. Being there is like walking on a dream, the nature, the atmosphere it is, indeed magical.

240910157.name: A Sunken Oasis in the Middle of a Busy City
240910157.author: a TripAdvisor user
240910157.reviewBody: What a surprise! This is one of the most beautiful city parks I have visited. I almost hate to say more because what made it so magical was that its beauty was so unexpected. I felt like I had wandered into a "secret garden". I will leave it to you to discover its secrets on your own.

216576424.name: Beautiful park!
216576424.author: a TripAdvisor user
216576424.reviewBody: If you want to spend a few hours hiking or jogging or simply visiting the exuberant nature, this is a place into the city of Xalapa where you can do it!\nThere is a peripheral trail about one mile long with ups and downs; you can run or walk enjoying the view. In the main there are diferent facilities (restroom, food), lakes with big fishes, swings, and so on.

208937202.name: beautiful
208937202.author: a TripAdvisor user
208937202.reviewBody: This park is a jewel in a city full of gems.  It is an escape from the bustle and noise of the busy downtown.  Children will love to feed the fish and turtles, the large playgrounds, and the snake exhibit.  I must visit for families in Xalapa.

207598776.name: Enjoyable park within walking distance of downtown
207598776.author: a TripAdvisor user
207598776.reviewBody: The Parque Los Tecajetes is located in what once a quarry, so it somewhat resembles Butchart Gardens on Vancour Island, Canada, but with an even luster vegetation The large fountain sculpture is very impressive and the landscaping is very well done. Definitely worth a visit for a relaxing walk.

205965011.name: Worth a visit if you have spare time
205965011.author: a TripAdvisor user
205965011.reviewBody: Well, I don\'t know which park the rest of the reviewers went to, but if Tecajetes is the one with the turtles, this park is not maintained which is a shame as it is a nice park and has the potential to be much more.  Different paths to walk on, a few different watering holes for the turtles.  But the water is icky in all the ponds, the plants, seating areas, etc. aren\'t maintained at all and there is nobody overseeing the treatment of the turtles by the Mexicans (many of whom don\'t know how to treat animals, let alone wildlife).  Strangely, there\'s a basketball court in part of the park.  There\'s also a short zip-line in the park, free to everyone.  It is manned.  Word of warning: best not to go if it\'s been raining as there are many areas of dirt which just become mud puddles or lakes.

203515396.name: Beautiful.
203515396.author: a TripAdvisor user
203515396.reviewBody: What a great way to spend an afternoon (or morning listening to all the birds!). There are plenty of plants and trees to see - lists of flowers and several places to sit and enjoy them.\n\nIn the \'center\' of things. Well worth your time. Bring a book and enjoy the pace. Then head to one of the restaurants just outside the park. Beautiful way to spend some time.

193004262.name: Not Wilderness
193004262.author: a TripAdvisor user
193004262.reviewBody: but a nice family oriented park that\'s especially fun on a Sunday.  If you want to feel that you\'re in nature, I suggest instead the Cerro del Macuitepetl.

180197419.name: Amazing park in the middle of the city
180197419.author: a TripAdvisor user
180197419.reviewBody: I was waiting for much less going in. Everything is so clean, so taken care-of. The ponds are full with huge Koi fish and turtles. There\'s a natural spring on the park that feeds water to the ponds, canals and aqueduct. There are numerous trails to discover. There\'s a herpetarium and you can even handle hawks, eagles and owls, free of charge. And the coolest thing is that you can zip-line through the entire park. Loved it.

170609605.name: small but beutyful.
170609605.author: a TripAdvisor user
170609605.reviewBody: Impressive nature all around Xalapa, perfect for birdwatching.  This Park has many old Jacaranda trees.  It even has a small and safe zip wire for kids.  Perfect for families when downtown Xalapa almost, is good to walk or even venture out on a bus ride around the downtown area, afterwards.

150278236.name: Turtles and water
150278236.author: a TripAdvisor user
150278236.reviewBody: This parc is not the biggest of Xalapa but it\'s really nice. \nThere is a lot of water, fishes and turtles. There is also a little museum with snakes. \nIt\'s fame in the city for the couples who goes there

144558393.name: Nice and green!!!
144558393.author: a TripAdvisor user
144558393.reviewBody: Nice park in the middle of town. Playground needs maintenance. Gardens are beautiful and they have water all over.

130600711.name: Respite from a hectic city
130600711.author: a TripAdvisor user
130600711.reviewBody: Certainly not what I expected but so much more. I expected to find some local plants with some sprinkled in water features. What I found was I reserve in the city with pathways meandering through native cloud forest fauna. But, wait a minute, here\'s a little playground, there\'s a roller blade track, oh, a climbing wall and zip line. Very memorable visit.

124578358.name: It\'s beautiful
124578358.author: a TripAdvisor user
124578358.reviewBody: A one-of-a-kind with gorgeous plants and water features!

123998746.name: A nice park
123998746.author: a TripAdvisor user
123998746.reviewBody: One natural spot to do your morning exercises. It has a lot of vegetation.

123675574.name: Best of the many parks in Xalapa
123675574.author: a TripAdvisor user
123675574.reviewBody: Tecajetes is my favorite park in Xalapa (and there are many beautiful ones).  This one is special because it it built and landscaped into a little canyon, and you can circle it on many levels.  At the top is a building where snakes are exhibited in terrariums and birds of prey can be seen up close tethered to tree stumps.  There are also large ponds for some very large koi.  The fountains and the faux ruins are fascinating.  It\'s a magical place.

671223879.name: green and misty
671223879.author: a TripAdvisor user
671223879.reviewBody: Jalapa\u00b4s beautiful and misty park n the middle of Veracruces capital city, good for every walk, a talk on a bench, a munchy time for elotes and churros, childrens playground and right beside the University grounds.  Misty by sundown with enormous trees, an oasis.

666015408.name: A city park with a unique atmosphere.
666015408.author: a TripAdvisor user
666015408.reviewBody: I used to live a block from this park, and I went jogging there every morning. It has ancient trees and it has a special flavour that is impossible to describe. It is typically Xalape\u00f1o. If you are in Xalapa, it is a must.

516482233.name: Don\'t miss this lovely park
516482233.author: a TripAdvisor user
516482233.reviewBody: I enjoyed an early morning stroll here and complimented its friendly gardener/caretaker. Then I walked to the park of the lakes. Within walking distance of the centro. In a city with many beautiful parks, be sure to include this on your list of ones to visit.

474416132.name: Enjoy riding your bike and walking on nature.
474416132.author: a TripAdvisor user
474416132.reviewBody: This place is beautiful and you can either walk or ride a bike here. Also, you will find some street vendors with local food. It is a quiet place to relax and enjoy.

460477000.name: Typical place to visit with the family
460477000.author: a TripAdvisor user
460477000.reviewBody: Sundays has a great variety of activities to kids can enjoy, walk on ponies, clowns, balloons, nice place to walk and full of history.

413918809.name: Great place for family time - especially on Sunday\'s!
413918809.author: a TripAdvisor user
413918809.reviewBody: This is a park down the street from where my mom grew up. Every Sunday they have a little train that goes around the park with different characters. Sunday\'s is really the time to go - they have little mini horses that children can go on. They rent bikes and have trampolines for the kids. Just a fun and lovely place for a family to enjoy an afternoon.

362921072.name: Maybe the nicest park in xalapa
362921072.author: a TripAdvisor user
362921072.reviewBody: The park is old and pleasantly designed with two circular roads around the central gazebo. There are lots of trees, some very large sycamores.  On sundays there are lots of vendors and even more people.  If you get away from the roads that border about 2/3 of the park, it is quiet.  Lots of benches for sitting (often occupied by couples being friendly with each other)

297590399.name: Nice park in central Xalapa. Really nice for a walk amongst Xalape\u00f1os!
297590399.author: a TripAdvisor user
297590399.reviewBody: Nice park in central Xalapa. Really nice for a walk amongst Xalape\u00f1os! \n\nThis is a family park on the weekend so it is really nice to stroll around with the local families eat an ice cream or a snack and just relax when visiting Xalapa.

654627481.name: Un domingo familiar!!
654627481.author: a TripAdvisor user
654627481.reviewBody:
Nos gusta mucho ir a correr por
La mañana, tiene diferentes senderos, diferentes rutas y se puede andar en bici también.
Falta que tengan más cuidado con la basura por qué lo botes aveces desbordan.
Puedes observar flora y fauna de la región.

635623322.name: Encuentro con la naturaleza
635623322.author: a TripAdvisor user
635623322.reviewBody: Uno de los parques m\u00e1s grandes de xalapa, ideal para caminatas, bicicletas o patinaje. Cuenta con diversas canchas para basketball y futbol y ba\u00f1os, conforme uno se va adentrando al parque tiene mayor contacto de la naturaleza, cuenta con horario de entrada/salida por lo que sera mejor planear la visita, ideal para convivir en familia y conocer m\u00e1s sobre la naturaleza de la ciudad.

602914719.name: Diversi\u00f3n al natural
602914719.author: a TripAdvisor user
602914719.reviewBody: Es un parque que debes visitar, donde puedes realizar ejercicios al aire libre, caminata, o solo ir a disfrutar de la naturaleza solo o en compa\u00f1\u00eda de pareja, amigos, familia e incluso llevar algunos alimentos preparados y hacer un d\u00eda de campo en la ciudad.

600450450.name: Un lugar 1000% NATURAL
600450450.author: a TripAdvisor user
600450450.reviewBody: Es una gran reserva ecol\u00f3gica en la ciudad capital a donde se puede asistir a realizar diversas actividades al aire libre. Posee una gran variedad en vegetaci\u00f3n y fauna end\u00e9mica de la regi\u00f3n, con suerte y puedas apreciar la belleza de un halc\u00f3n que se pasea por el lugar.\nExcelente para hacer ejercicio al aire libre, andar en bicicleta, ir a pasar un rato agradable con la familia, con ni\u00f1os peque\u00f1os por su seguridad y con los amigos.  Perfecto para hacer un picnic y alejarte de los ruidos y la contaminaci\u00f3n de la ciudad.  Simplemente HERMOSO!\nY para que as\u00ed siga, \u00a1no olvides llevarte tu basura y cuidar  tan bell\u00edsimo lugar!

539464397.name: Aire libre y ejercicio
539464397.author: a TripAdvisor user
539464397.reviewBody: El parque natura es un atractivo para un d\u00eda de campo o hacer ejercicio ya que cuenta con \u00e1reas para azar carne, comer y espacios para el juego, la recreaci\u00f3n y el deporte (carrera, trote) adem\u00e1s de poder hacer paseos en bicicleta acompa\u00f1ado de tu familia

539175681.name: Bonito lugar protegido, para la poblacion local, no para turistas!!
539175681.author: a TripAdvisor user
539175681.reviewBody: Es un bonito lugar, donde la poblaci\u00f3n local puede pasear y dar una vuelta, es una zona protegida, pero sin ningun atractivo para turistas.

507926361.name: Reserva ecol\u00f3gica oxigeno para respirar
507926361.author: a TripAdvisor user
507926361.reviewBody: El parque natura es una reserva en medio de la ciudad con aprox. 130 hect\u00e1reas de naturaleza en donde puedes hacer caminatas, paseos en bicicletas, ejercicio, a los ni\u00f1os les encanta hay fauna silvestre y cuenta con infraestructura es un lugar magico

474323079.name: Encantador!!!
474323079.author: a TripAdvisor user
474323079.reviewBody: Nos encanta ir a hacer ejercicio cada ma\u00f1ana durante nuestras visitas a Xalapa. Much\u00edsima seguridad, tranquilo y lleno de paz. Uno de los mejores lugares en la capital de Veracruz.

462579220.name: Excelente encontrarse con la naturaleza
462579220.author: a TripAdvisor user
462579220.reviewBody: Es un parque muy grande, tranquilo y lleno de vegetaci\u00f3n, me encanta ir a correr ah\u00ed ya que tiene pendientes es excelente para poner a prueba la condici\u00f3n f\u00edsica, el paisaje del lugar es para encontrarte solo tu y la naturaleza. Tambi\u00e9n hay una parte donde hay algunas especies de animales, hay juegos y tiene una ciclov\u00eda, estacionamiento y sanitarios.

447935978.name: Hermoso!
447935978.author: a TripAdvisor user
447935978.reviewBody: Este sitio es maravilloso para ir con la familia (hay juegos para ni\u00f1os), volar papalotes, andas en bicicleta, correr, etc. Adem\u00e1s, es uno de los sitios en lo que se puede ver m\u00e1s vida silvestre en la ciudad!

404168068.name: Precioso lugar en xalapa
404168068.author: a TripAdvisor user
404168068.reviewBody: Es  el pulm\u00f3n de Xalapa \u00e1rea verde apta para  andar en bicicleta aunque tiene muchas bajadas y subidas. Tratar de ir acompa\u00f1ado para evitar alg\u00fan susto ya que es tan grande que la vigilacia no se da abasto

460478312.name: One of the principal Museums in Xalapa
460478312.author: a TripAdvisor user
460478312.reviewBody: A Museum full of activities, espectacular for kids, with interactive rooms, very interesting place for all ages.

address.streetAddress: Av. Rafael Murillo Vidal No. 1735 col. Cuahctemoc

447935446.name: The kids have a great time
447935446.author: a TripAdvisor user
447935446.reviewBody: The site is okay. Although, it costs some money (approx. 3 USD a piece) and it really needs some upgrades, kids love it.

address.streetAddress: Av. Rafael Murillo Vidal No. 1735 col. Cuahctemoc

367587883.name: Don\'t do it!!
367587883.author: a TripAdvisor user
367587883.reviewBody: I lived in Xalapa for a couple of years and went there thinking it would be a cool option one afternoon.  All I can say is don\'t waste your time.  Head to the Museum of Anthropology instead and you will be blown away by their collection of Olmec artifacts!

address.streetAddress: Av. Rafael Murillo Vidal No. 1735 col. Cuahctemoc

297594565.name: Overrated ... there are better equivalents in other cities!
297594565.author: a TripAdvisor user
297594565.reviewBody: Overrated ... there are better equivalents in other cities! We went to a similar Museum in San Luis Potos\u00ed which was far better with more interesting interactive exhibits and it appears to be a bit dated (also the Papalote in Mexico City seems better as well). \n\nThis place needs a serious makeover quickly. Not worth it unless you have time to burn in Xalapa.

address.streetAddress: Av. Rafael Murillo Vidal No. 1735 col. Cuahctemoc

260070175.name: Kids learning and entertainment by interaction
260070175.author: a TripAdvisor user
260070175.reviewBody: Great option to spend time with kids by learning and interacting with the museum exhibitions. Museum staff well trained with the activities and willing to assist the kids through each of them and more important entertainment and participation by knowing and experiencing science, maths, music and sounds, transportation, health, nature conservation, etc.

address.streetAddress: Av. Rafael Murillo Vidal No. 1735 col. Cuahctemoc

253698518.name: Good fun for all ages
253698518.author: a TripAdvisor user
253698518.reviewBody: My kids are 9 and 13 and they loved this place. You can easily spend the whole day there. We also enjoyed the planetarium. Xalapa parents are lucky. I wish there was a museum like that in my home town of Brasilia.

address.streetAddress: Av. Rafael Murillo Vidal No. 1735 col. Cuahctemoc

143109934.name: Underwhelming
143109934.author: a TripAdvisor user
143109934.reviewBody: So much interaction seems to have taken its toll. The permanent exhibits need a makeover. Most either don\'t work, barely work, or are missing pieces. This museum provides less than an hour\'s worth of entertainment.

address.streetAddress: Av. Rafael Murillo Vidal No. 1735 col. Cuahctemoc

549797518.name: The cave is closed only the small garden where it is located is open
549797518.author: a TripAdvisor user
549797518.reviewBody: The cave is located in a small garden which is OK, it takes about 5 minutes to walk around it. Actually the garden is above the cave. The cave looks nice from outside but you are not allowed to enter since it is closed. They mentioned that it was close due to the earthquakes. There is no indication that it is close and when we asked in the hotel no one mentioned that it is close, luckily it was 10 minutes from the hotel.

666103974.name: Xalapas Central Park
666103974.author: a TripAdvisor user
666103974.reviewBody: This park is in the historic district and host many activities during weekends.  There is a playground and a statuary of the four virtues.

658176812.name: Such a pretty view!
658176812.author: a TripAdvisor user
658176812.reviewBody: It has such a beautiful view at night. You can see a wonderful picture of the city\'s lights here, and also you can have some typical mexican snacks. At daytime its a very nice place to spend the time at, but at night you can have some feelings of insecurity. So always try to go with someone and not alone :)

618021507.name: Hsilly town
618021507.author: a TripAdvisor user
618021507.reviewBody: Xalapa is so hilly that its main plaza is a series of smaller plazas connected by staircases. It\'s very pretty, with lovely vistas, lively crowds and lots of trees. The cathedral, of course, is right nearby, but as it is up the hill it is not the ubiquitous presence it is in every other Mexican town.

610686531.name: Gives a great
610686531.author: a TripAdvisor user
610686531.reviewBody: Overlooks the south of the city and the university.  Not far from the Catholic cathedral and the municipal buildings. A place to take a rest and relax.

560722377.name: Lots going on here
560722377.author: a TripAdvisor user
560722377.reviewBody: Parque Juarez, aka the Zocalo, is unique in its multiple levels with stairways all over the place.  It\'s built on quite a steep hill, so on a clear day you get an awesome city view including Mexico\'s highest mountain on the horizon.  There may be a craft show,  concert or Who Knows What going on when you visit, so you may end up staying longer than you planned.

554477526.name: Great views from City Park
554477526.author: a TripAdvisor user
554477526.reviewBody: On a clear day, can have magical views. Wa a little overcast, so didn\'t get the best of Xalapa, but plenty of food vendors and lively City environment\n

495237497.name: Lovely wiews over Xalapa
495237497.author: a TripAdvisor user
495237497.reviewBody: As you might expect, this square is adjacent to the government building, ( where you might  pop in to see the murals) and has a nice variety of trees and benches to sit in the shade. At the end the square overlooks the town and on a clear day you see Orizaba.\nBy that end of the park is a lovely cafe, highly recommended!

477917107.name: A lovely town square
477917107.author: a TripAdvisor user
477917107.reviewBody: Parque Juarez is a lovely, park-like square in the historic center of Xalapa.  It is a good place to relax among the locals and enjoy the remarkable views of the surrounding mountains and the rooftops of the city.  We were there in the early evening and enjoyed the playing of a concert band and drum and bugle corps as the large Mexican flag was lowered.

463752577.name: Centerpiece of lovely Xalapa
463752577.author: a TripAdvisor user
463752577.reviewBody: Early mornings and late evenings are the best time to spend time here.  I visited Xalapa over the weekend and there was dancing all day on Sunday till late and Saturday morning was worthy of a few hours to relax and enjoy seeing the locals make use of this beautiful space.

444247948.name: Obligatory place to visit in Xalapa
444247948.author: a TripAdvisor user
444247948.reviewBody: Ubicated in the downtown in the city next to Goberment State Building and The Catedral, is a very good pointo to see a part of the city.

444106013.name: Xalapa\'s Main Square
444106013.author: a TripAdvisor user
444106013.reviewBody: Great place to hang out. Lots of birds to feed and take pics, very nice scenery. You find locals selling popcorn and churros, etc.

413919771.name: Feed the pigeons and enjoy life!
413919771.author: a TripAdvisor user
413919771.reviewBody: There\'s always people sitting in the park enjoying the day. A favorite of mine is to buy rice and feed the pigeons. A must see in Xalapa! If you walk away from the Main Street you can also find some great views of the city .

345988572.name: Haven in city.
345988572.author: a TripAdvisor user
345988572.reviewBody: A good place to orient self to centre town. Lots going on and nice green space with great coffee place across the street. Watched recruits doing their training and found crafts in the park on Saturday \n

344832775.name: Nice park
344832775.author: a TripAdvisor user
344832775.reviewBody: If the weather is good you have a fine panorama over the mountains, but most of the time it is cloudy. There is always something to see in the park, so it is nice to walk around

336108585.name: Lovely park in a very smoggy area
336108585.author: a TripAdvisor user
336108585.reviewBody: This park is well liked by locals and is designed with multiple levels. Unfortunately, the downtown area is clogged with slow moving traffic. The city\'s poor transportation system is accompanied by hundreds of taxicabs that drive non-stop trying to pick up pedestrians.

325090970.name: Beautiful place to go for walks!
325090970.author: a TripAdvisor user
325090970.reviewBody: By all means take every opportunity to enjoy nature in this lovely park.We were there in October, which was a good time of the year to go for walks.

297593360.name: Historical park smack in the center of Xalapa ... could almost be considered a plaza.
297593360.author: a TripAdvisor user
297593360.reviewBody: Historical park smack in the center of Xalapa ... could almost be considered a plaza. The large patio area that extends out on one side offers wonderful views of the city below ... and on the weekends it is bustling with food vendors and musicians.

282257161.name: Tiny but nice
282257161.author: a TripAdvisor user
282257161.reviewBody: The park is the center of Xalapa with street-artists, tiny kiosks and a few restaurants nearby. The trees give shade during a hot summer day. But you won\'t spend more than an hour here, though it\'s nice to eat some street-food there and watch the authentic mexican life passing you by.

242938321.name: Great for Running During the Day
242938321.author: a TripAdvisor user
242938321.reviewBody: Went for a run here in the late afternoon.  Lot of people out running, walking, and browsing.  Lots of students and easy to navigate.  Monuments were very interesting.  Great way to experience a busy city!

242113052.name: Delightful
242113052.author: a TripAdvisor user
242113052.reviewBody:
A very pleasant park that is terraced with several levels and lots of plants and trees.  Nice views of the surrounding city and nearby mountains. Some of the trees are really, really tall! There a lots of places to sit and chat or people watch.

A nice surprise was an internet center with (apparently)free computer and internet access in the park. The front of the small building is all glass affording one a nice view out the windows. The computers appeared to be modern with flat screen monitors.

There are food and drink vendors but not so many as to be intrusive. They seem to be clustered together so the rest of the park is tranquil.

Great for families or singles and particularly couples.

207607919.name: In the heart of Xalapa
207607919.author: a TripAdvisor user
207607919.reviewBody: This park is great for people watching with its many park benches and a marvelous view of the Sierra Madre Oriental mountain range when the sky is clear. The Pico de Orizaba(Citlaltepetl which means "Mountain of the galaxy) 18,000 foot volcanic peak covered with snow is very impressive, as well as the Naucantepetl(Cofre de Perote) to the west. \nThere are stands which sell food and a tourist modular for information. There are also balloon sellers, street musicians, mimes, living statues, etc., as well as the  clowns on weekends. Our bicycle activist group, Veracruz en Bicicleta, has a free bicycle safety school at the park every Sunday from 10 AM to 2 PM. You are cordially invited to participate and there are free loaner bicycles. \u00a1Hasta pronto!

205966847.name: Near this park is also...
205966847.author: a TripAdvisor user
205966847.reviewBody: If you go towards the back of the park and look down, you\'ll see a lake and a pedestrian path surrounding it.  This is another nice area of downtown to go for a walk.  There\'s a cultural center there as well as a playground area for the kiddies, a place to rent water cycles, bicycles for rent ($10 pesos for 1/2 an hour) and vendors.  At the head of the lake is a zip-line which is free to all.  I think it\'s only open on the weekends.  It\'s longer than the one in Parque Tecajetes - maybe 250 meters.\n\nPutting this on here as part of Juarez Park since TA never lists new places I try to add.

203653612.name: Corruption
203653612.author: a TripAdvisor user
203653612.reviewBody: After going to the bar late at night i stopped there to hang out with friends. All of a sudden 4 policemen come to us, surround us, and threaten us to jail if we dont give them 300 pesos. Said we qoukd never get out if we dont give them the money while dangling handcuffs. Serious threats! Gave them money and ran away. Parque juarez esta peligroso!

193004374.name: The Hub
193004374.author: a TripAdvisor user
193004374.reviewBody: of the city, with lots going on and a great view not only over the town but also to the neighboring hills and mountains.

148628841.name: It\'s an average park
148628841.author: a TripAdvisor user
148628841.reviewBody: Nothing expetional about this park, some nice trees, too many vendors. The best thing is, on a clear day, a nice view to Cofre de Perote Peak and Citlaltepetl or Orizaba Peak

146490803.name: Great gathering place
146490803.author: a TripAdvisor user
146490803.reviewBody: The large central jardin is clean, attractive, has big trees and lots of friendly people with nteresting art-deco buildings, stairways and plazas. Sunday is a big family day in the park with lots of vendors, buskers ad action.

143880570.name: Nice Center of town
143880570.author: a TripAdvisor user
143880570.reviewBody: Its a nice central park of several acres.  Visit only if you\'re in town.  \nThe trees are splendid and huge, and there\'s numerous exotic flowering plants.

138359129.name: Peace in the centre of the State Capital..
138359129.author: a TripAdvisor user
138359129.reviewBody: Having seen Jalapa in 1987, the only change in the place is that there is much more vehicular traffic [ and it is a place that can get congested ]  and lots more people..BUT the city has been well maintained by the administrators and  the park and Zocalo have been the recipients of this care and attention; so it is a welcome rest spot after walking around, what is definitely, an interesting city.   Walk up the hilly area of the city and wander around some of the quaint alleys and lanes; some of which are reminicent of European towns!

128642114.name: The park was near the hotel.
128642114.author: a TripAdvisor user
128642114.reviewBody: It affords views of the part of the city below. It is nice, but if it had more vegetation, it would be even nicer.

123998817.name: Good park to walk around right in downtown
123998817.author: a TripAdvisor user
123998817.reviewBody: It\'s right in downtown. Beside the cathedral and has a nice area where you can see the lower part of the city

123675623.name: Great for people watching
123675623.author: a TripAdvisor user
123675623.reviewBody: This is the heart of the centro historico, a great place to sit and watch the people.  It\'s got a lot of very tall trees that shade the whole park, and her you can try an "esquite," a cup of steamed corn kernels prepared with mayonaise, lemon, parmesan cheese, and chile powder as hot or mild as you request.

89444800.name: A nice park that acts like a main plaza
89444800.author: a TripAdvisor user
89444800.reviewBody: Much is crammed into the center of Xalapa including this park. Across the street in one direction is the city government building and across another street is the state government building. Cross another street is the large city library. Kitty corner is the cathedral with the main street running through all these. The park is about the size of a very large city block and feels like a terrace with a good view of part of the city facing still another direction because of the hills that are in Xalapa. There is no zocalo in Xalapa so this park sort of becomes a replacement for the missing main plaza. The park includes the normal benches, food stalls, balloon sellers, and more. If you walk to the rear side of the park and look down you will find El Agora which is a cultural center and includes an art gallery, information office, and small outdoor theatre for musical shows.

369114768.name: Excellent place to know the history of the city
369114768.author: a TripAdvisor user
369114768.reviewBody: Known as "Old cementery" the place is great for lovers of cementeries tourism. Here you can see tombs from late XIX century of famous xalapenians, people who helped to build the city. From masons to wealthy foreigners. If you wish to visit it you should contact the Xalapa Guides.

address.streetAddress: Calle 5 de Febrero S/N 20 de Noviembre y Poeta Jesus Diaz

672339919.name: Sus exposiciones son interesante
672339919.author: a TripAdvisor user
672339919.reviewBody: sus exposiciones son interesantes, abstente de consumir en los restaurantes de su entrada son car\u00edsimos!!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Arco Sur 72 Plaza Arco Sur

548489284.name: Me encant\u00f3
548489284.author: a TripAdvisor user
548489284.reviewBody: Es un espacio nuevo y muy padre, desde las exposiciones, las obras, la arquitectura. Totalmente recomendado para los locales y los turistas!!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Arco Sur 72 Plaza Arco Sur

548487203.name: Excelente
548487203.author: a TripAdvisor user
548487203.reviewBody: La galer\u00eda es lo m\u00e1ximo, me encanta todo, es un espacio para todo tipo de gente y es una experiencia \u00fanica, se los recomiendo.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Arco Sur 72 Plaza Arco Sur

555491608.name: Peque\u00f1o, tranquilo y muy relajante
555491608.author: a TripAdvisor user
555491608.reviewBody: En Xalapa, Veracruz dentro del Fracc. LAS ANIMAS se encuentra este hermoso parque. Es peque\u00f1o y tranaquilo, puedes visitarlo solo o con la familia, encuentras ardillas, patos, gansos y peces grandes dentro de los lagos "artificiales" que colindan con este parque.Es una opcion para estar en contacto con la naturaleza dentro de la ciudad.

518625009.name: Parque local
518625009.author: a TripAdvisor user
518625009.reviewBody: Este parque es un sitio muy hermoso donde la gente va a correr, caminar, andar en bicicleta, etc. La vegetaci\u00f3n es hermosa, est\u00e1n los lagos, etc...

471920558.name: Un poco descuidado pero es un lugar bello
471920558.author: a TripAdvisor user
471920558.reviewBody: Un parque muy bello que normalmente esta muy descuidado, La gente que vive cerca tiene una opci\u00f3n para hacer ejercicio en las ma\u00f1anas y llevar a los ni\u00f1os a jugar por las tardes. Cruza el r\u00edo de las \u00e1nimas, a veces muchos mosquitos.

463777978.name: un rinc\u00f3n paradisiaco en medio de la ciudad
463777978.author: a TripAdvisor user
463777978.reviewBody: Es un parque plano (pocos en Xalapa lo son), donde se re\u00fanen los ni\u00f1os y los ancianos de la zona. Muy agradable para caminar entre los lagos y el riachuelo que lo cruza. Excelente para un descanso a mitad de la tarde o hacer ejercicio

453085864.name: es un buen parque dominguero
453085864.author: a TripAdvisor user
453085864.reviewBody: vivo cerca de ahi esta un poco descuidado el parque por falta de mantenimiento pero sin embargo es bonito.buen paseo familiar y sus arroyos son de gran atraccion para los ni\u00f1os.por cierto pasean muchos perros por ahi

445364469.name: Un hermoso parquesito ubicado en el Fraccionamiento Las \u00c1nimas
445364469.author: a TripAdvisor user
445364469.reviewBody: Es un parque peque\u00f1o, tranquilo y que gustan las familias, las parejas y los que se ejercitan en caminata para visitar. Las tardes son agradables para toda persona que desea ponerse en contacto con la naturaleza.

374185444.name: Precioso lugar
374185444.author: a TripAdvisor user
374185444.reviewBody: Es un  parque muy sombreado de los que ya quedan pocos lo mismo puedes ir a caminar que a disfrutar un rato con la naturaleza, Esta dentro del fraccionamiento las animas y eso hace que no haya tanto ruido de coches, y que la pases bien\n\n

360506751.name: Excelente lugar para caminar y pasear a las mascotas
360506751.author: a TripAdvisor user
360506751.reviewBody: Un parque aunque no de grandes dimensiones,  bien cuidado, con arroyos que corren en canales bien dise\u00f1ados y andadores atractivos rodeados de plantas y vegetaci\u00f3n en buen estado, ideal para pasear a la mascota y ni\u00f1os.

359481183.name: Agradable sitio
359481183.author: a TripAdvisor user
359481183.reviewBody:
Tienes mascotas? este es un buen lugar para acudir ahí a pasear con ellos.

Buena vegetación.

Te recomiendo ir de dia.

306384173.name: tranquilidad y paz
306384173.author: a TripAdvisor user
306384173.reviewBody: tienen q conocerlo, es un lugar muy tranquilo, a gusto :) en paz con la familia o con tu compa\u00f1ia en contacto con la naturaleza

294551697.name: No lo recomiendo.
294551697.author: a TripAdvisor user
294551697.reviewBody: Peque\u00f1o rinc\u00f3n de \u00e1rea verde, con hermosos \u00e1rboles en el coraz\u00f3n de la ciudad pero suele ser peligroso porque no hay vigilancia. No lo recomiendo.

477916027.name: A fun shopping alley
477916027.author: a TripAdvisor user
477916027.reviewBody: Callejon del Diamante is a narrow, steeply inclined pedestrian alley lined with vendors and small shops located one block from the Zocalo.   Climbing to the end of the Callejon and then descending back to the beginning was reminiscent of Hong Kong many years ago. Most of the shops and vendors are offering tourist wares and head shop paraphernalia, but there a few hidden treasures to be found.  We picked up a half kilo of the famous local coffee and had a taste of the brew at Caf\u00e9 Cali, located at the lower end of the street.

address.streetAddress: Antonio M. de Rivera Intersection with Juan Enriquez

646109078.name: Uno de los sitios hist\u00f3ricos de la Ciudad
646109078.author: a TripAdvisor user
646109078.reviewBody: Esta en buen estado la pista , pero las gradas y el exterior le falta mantenimiento. Pero su historia en la Ciudad de Xalapa es de gran importancia. Visita obligada para los deportistas

600944429.name: Ejercicio en lugar privilegiado
600944429.author: a TripAdvisor user
600944429.reviewBody: Si te gusta hacer ejercicio al aire libre no puedes perderte la oportunidad de ir al estadio, ya sea a caminar o correr. Es una sensaci\u00f3n incre\u00edble, poder estar all\u00ed, ya que tiene unas excelentes instalaciones. Est\u00e1 abierto al p\u00fablico todos los d\u00edas de 6:00 a 22:00 hrs, excepto el domingo que es de 8:00 a 13:00 hrs.

599378092.name: Hermoso estadio
599378092.author: a TripAdvisor user
599378092.reviewBody: \u00c9ste estadio es un complejo ol\u00edmpico, es perfecto para competencias de atletismo, muy recomendable para visitar en Xalapa por su apariencia arquitect\u00f3nica que es hermosa.

201330637.name: Next door to my house
201330637.author: a TripAdvisor user
201330637.reviewBody: Every time I go into the Patio Mu\u00f1oz, which is almost next door to where I live, I am transported into another era. The sights, sounds, and smells of this "vecindad"

344976535.name: Nice art center
344976535.author: a TripAdvisor user
344976535.reviewBody: Small but it\'s a good place where you can find some art. It\'s free and every season there\'s a new exhibition  \nit\'s near to Juarez park and downtown

180218781.name: Art gallery
180218781.author: a TripAdvisor user
180218781.reviewBody: Located on the lower side of the Parque Ju\u00e1rez in downtown Xalapa, this gallery is definitely worth a visit since it has new displays about every month. It is also next to the Xalapa city museum, so you can see both in less than an hour. The Carlos Fuentes library is just across the Street, and there is ample bicycle parking, too!!!

402900155.name: Pour le petits et les grands
402900155.author: a TripAdvisor user
402900155.reviewBody: Si vous parlez un peu espagnol (ou \u00eates en train d\'apprendre, les pi\u00e8ces pour enfants permettent d\'apprendre du vocabulaire), c\'est un excellent endroit.\nLe t\u00e9atre fait 120 places (je ne crois pas qu\'il y ait aussi grand en France), il y a des pi\u00e8ces pour enfants mais aussi pour les plus grands, le staff est tr\u00e8s chaleureux, les techniques, d\u00e9cors et marionnettes, toutes faites sur place par les \u00e9quipes, c\'est bluffant.\nLes taxi ne connaissent pas tous, demandez l\'intersection Juarez/ Camacho. C\'est l\'\u00e9difice rouge en haut de la mont\u00e9e.

itemReviewed.name: El Rincon de Los TIteres Teatro Foro

630352683.name: Disappointed
630352683.author: a TripAdvisor user
630352683.reviewBody: The only thing this place have related with Diego Rivera is the name, the "art"/works displayed are not interesting at all, the majority of the thing displayed felt like they were projects from the freshman of some local art school.

541940264.name: Fabulous collection
541940264.author: a TripAdvisor user
541940264.reviewBody:
Unlike many previous reviewers I visited the gallery when there was a large number of Rivera works on display, fresh from a tour to the far east. I wondered why there was a museum devoted to this top class artist in Xalapa but the museum explained that an ex governor of Veracruz state supported Rivera and other artists at the beginning of their careers.
There were over 45 works by Rivera on display covering all stages of his life from his earliest works of fairly naïve landscapes, through his time in Paris and return to Mexico followed by the last year of his life in Russia.
There was also a nice collection of photographs of Diego with various wives including Frida.
I was the only visitor to this museum which is crazy considering the importance of Rivera to Mexican art of the 20th Century. This may be due to the poor reviews on this site and the lack of Rivera works previously or it could be down to the fact that both major guide books (Lonely Planet and Rough Guides) have the location shown incorrectly on their Xalapa maps and are both fairly dismissive of the place.
It shows that its always worth seeking places out and making your own mind!
As a bonus it was free enty too!

496353668.name: OK
496353668.author: a TripAdvisor user
496353668.reviewBody: I\'m not very knowledgeable about Rivera\'s work, so the small collection contained nothing that I recognized. There were some interesting facts about the painter and his work contained in the information posted next to each work. If you are a Rivera fan you\'ll probably get more out of this attraction than I did. Admission is free.

335834518.name: There are no Diego Rivera paintings here!
335834518.author: a TripAdvisor user
335834518.reviewBody: We were very disappointed to find that the Diego Rivera paintings have all been permanently moved to the city of Orizaba

213709074.name: A Wonderful Gallery
213709074.author: a TripAdvisor user
213709074.reviewBody: I visited the Pinocateca today, and there was a wonderful exhibit of photos--landscapes documenting the changes in the Veracruz landscapes a result of modernization.  A photographer friend who was with me on the visit said the quality of the photographs was like nothing he had seen for quite some time.  The quality of the exhibits here is always excellent.  But don\'t expect to see Riveras here; they were moved to a museum in the city of Cordoba some time ago.  The gallery is named in honor of Rivera as the library across the street is named in honor of Carlos Fuentes.  (You will probably find some or all of his books there.)

201463498.name: No Rivera Again
201463498.author: a TripAdvisor user
201463498.reviewBody:
This is an art gallery ONLY
It clearly does not have anything to do with Diego Rivera.
Interesting exhibit about how we are raping the land. Photos mostly.
Don't expect to see see ANY Riveras

124615672.name: No Riveras
124615672.author: a TripAdvisor user
124615672.reviewBody: Unfortunately, all Rivera paintings were out on loan when I visited. There was an interesting temporary exhibition of ceramics works by two brother artists.

124531824.name: Could be better
124531824.author: a TripAdvisor user
124531824.reviewBody: Some years ago the small exhibition gallery was open to house some local artists. Perhaps it has reached its goal, but the quality of the exhibitions are not great, from pottery to paintings, this free gallery is open to everyone. When taking a tour in Xalapa, make some time (20 mins will do) to visit this space, located just down of the stairs of Xalapa\'s Main Public Park.

123675627.name: Great exhibit space, interesting art
123675627.author: a TripAdvisor user
123675627.reviewBody: I try to catch every exhibit here.  The art is sometimes contemporary, sometimes historic.  Never boring.  Always free.

62116461.name: false no diego rivera paintings here
62116461.author: a TripAdvisor user
62116461.reviewBody: And there never have been evidently. Only in name. It is a small gallery with very good works but don\'t go looking for Diego Rivera\'s work. Go to Mexico City to the Palacio National to see his murals.

420604279.name: Muy buen servicio
420604279.author: a TripAdvisor user
420604279.reviewBody: El lugar ideal para planear unas buenas vacaciones o viajes de negocios, yo acud\u00ed y me ayudaron con los tramites de visa, excelente todo.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Rafael Murillo Vidal # 4 Col. Cuauhtemoc

137186988.name: falta un poquito de orientaciion
137186988.author: a TripAdvisor user
137186988.reviewBody: Mi esposo es el que participo en todo  el es ciclista, pero falta un poco de orientaci\u00f3n y de atenci\u00f3n

671223350.name: the most awkward story
671223350.author: a TripAdvisor user
671223350.reviewBody: I used to hear my grandmother talk about a friend of my grandfather that wanted once to steal a very important statue somewhere in Mexico called "El Se\u00f1or de los Limones" when I was a child.  I came to this museum for the first tme 20 years ago when I moved to this city, and to my surprise there it was, a small but imp`resive statue that had a leyend underneath that told the history of this archeological piece having once been stolen and recovered! I felt then that everything I thought was all part of my granny\u00b4s imagination was all true, and was amazed at the story and came back once and again, appreciating the greatness of the museum, the amazingly green and beautiful gardens and inmense statues and collection of pieces that are there at this beautiful accesible to everyone and as interesting as the one in Mexico city.  I highly recomed visiting it if you are once there, it has great history and magnificent explanations about mexican pre hispanic hstory.

668273738.name: Top quality museum
668273738.author: a TripAdvisor user
668273738.reviewBody: We were extremely impressed with the university owned anthropology museum which includes pieces only from Veracruz. There are so many quality pieces including 7 original Olmeca heads that weigh over 15 tons each. The history in this area is remarkable and they have done a wonderful hone of displaying and distributing the artwork. We highly recommend.

666099968.name: Second Best Museum in Mexico
666099968.author: a TripAdvisor user
666099968.reviewBody: This museum is second only to the anthropology museum in Mexico City.  The collection is excellent (some artifact were missing since they were on loan to other museums) and the layout is one of the best I have come across.  The museum has a large central corridor with large exhibit halls off the the right.  Between the exhibit halls are large courtyards that also have displays.  Each hall focuses on a particular civilization and the entire museum slopes down gently.  The halls and central hallway use an open concept so there is no working yourself through a maze of one small room to another.\n\nI took the audio tour which was well worth the money.

659577586.name: Not to be missed!
659577586.author: a TripAdvisor user
659577586.reviewBody: If you are interested in anthropology (primarily of the Olmec people this modern museum is not to be missed when you are in Xalapa.

640912384.name: Amazing, well organized. Good way to spend a morning
640912384.author: a TripAdvisor user
640912384.reviewBody: My wife and I stayed at a friends house about a 10 minute walk from here. There is a very comprehensive amount of info on the olmec and totonac cultures. The way that you keep descending is pretty neat. I loved the architecture and design of the building and the light. One of the better museums that I have been too and not too overwhelming so you can get everything out of it in a day

627585734.name: Splendid Museum
627585734.author: a TripAdvisor user
627585734.reviewBody: An absolute must. The have a truly impressive collection, with some of the most important artifacts unearthed in eastern M\u00e9xico. The chief attraction would, of course, have to be the Olmec heads, but there are many other stunning pieces as well. The museum is very well laid out, amidst a lovely park) with sensible curation (signage is in Spanish, but they had audio tours available). It is also a sensible size, and can be thoroughly covered in half a day without flattening your feet.  Admission for adults is 55 pesos. Also a very good bookstore.

618019823.name: A must
618019823.author: a TripAdvisor user
618019823.reviewBody: This museum is a must see. Its collection of Olmec art and artifacts is better and broader than the one at INAH, and it is better laid out. Go! It alone is reason to visit Xalapa.

611240328.name: Amazing collection!
611240328.author: a TripAdvisor user
611240328.reviewBody: Beautiful building with a chronological layout of pre-Colombian artifacts from Veracruz. Not to be missed!

610680157.name: An amazing view of early Mexico
610680157.author: a TripAdvisor user
610680157.reviewBody: We had the pleasure of a graduate student to give us a tour in English. It\'s an interesting, well laid out museum in chronological order. In about 2 hours he gave us a remarkable synopsis of the history of ancient Mexico.

598512073.name: Very nice museum and environment , should go
598512073.author: a TripAdvisor user
598512073.reviewBody:
Very nice museum and environment, you should go.
Olmeca and other prehispanic cultures in state of Veracruz. First time is recommended using a guide for getting the whole explanation.

582723823.name: Awesome!
582723823.author: a TripAdvisor user
582723823.reviewBody: We took the bus from Veracruz but a taxi back. This is an incredible museum for artifact buffs and of course they have the giant Olmec heads. The thing I learned is that the Olmecs had some really great artists. The faces on most of the sculptures are so well done and really show personalities. The Olmecs were before the Aztecs and Maya but better sculpturers imho. And the museum is just the right size. Not too big and not too small.

570248080.name: Beautifully designed. Informative and elegant.
570248080.author: a TripAdvisor user
570248080.reviewBody: Came through Xalapa on a day trip to Coatepec from Veracruz.The one Xalapa destination that we had on the list was the museum. It did not disappoint. Xalapa itself is a bit of a grimey town, but the museum is a bit of a elegant oasis. The exhibits are beautifully displayed in a series of galleries that are interspersed with open garden courtyards, that make for a nice breaking up in the experience. A bit like the Getty Villa in Malibu. There is also a long linking gallery that slopes through the length of the museum that adds to the drama. The highlights are, of course, the Olmec heads, but the museum has much more to offer than that. I have seen some comparisons here to the Anthropological Museum in Mexico City. It isn\'t quite as "impressive" as that museum, but it may be a bit more "immersive."

561822361.name: Most beautiful museum ever..so well done, it is like a dream.
561822361.author: a TripAdvisor user
561822361.reviewBody: Even if you are not into anthropology and ancient civilizations or museum walking, this place is still for you.  The museum is so well laid out and meshed with the outside environment, that even a stroll through it would be a mighty experience.  Spanish is required for reading the labels, but not for understanding.  I read Spanish but my friends could not, and they truly enjoyed this museum.  There is no onsite parking.  Parking is on the street surrounding the museum.  There are many taxis to be hail along the avenues.

560721834.name: Give this a long time, and go in well rested!
560721834.author: a TripAdvisor user
560721834.reviewBody:
This is a beautiful museum, with the best displays anywhere of artifacts from the ancient civilizations of this region.  If you're not going in on a guided tour, pay 55 pesos to rent their ipod with a wonderful guide app preloaded.  (You can also download it ahead of time for free, iPhone only so far.)
A note on the app:  it uses QR codes placed on many exhibits.  You just point the ipod camera at it and the narration begins.  Easiest system ever!
There is a small cafeteria; the nice lady behind the counter makes an excellent torts de Pollo (chicken sandwich)!  It is a tiny menu, but each item is made fresh, so take your time.
Restrooms are located only in the front of the building; you may well find yourself walking back there at some point in your tour.
Go be fascinated.

554477146.name: Must See in Xalapa
554477146.author: a TripAdvisor user
554477146.reviewBody:
After a good breakfast, we spent 2 hours at the Museum which was amazing.

The lengthy stroll thru the civilizations and experiencing the challenges of each culture and the tools necessary for survival, and how advanced each generation became, was incredible.

The museum is a long, cavernous, well laid out exhibition by Era. You can experience at your own pace with English information sheets to guide you along.

Parking is easy along the side road as long as your early.  By 10AM, your in trouble.

Folks are friendly, informative.. I only wish the bookstore/souvenir shop was more eared towards statues, art, chotskies, etc instead of just books & books, and some not even relevant to the museum.

Overall a grat place to visit

541938171.name: World class!
541938171.author: a TripAdvisor user
541938171.reviewBody:
Absolutely stunning museum which must rank as one of the worlds best alongside the anthropological museum in Mexico (I actually preferred it). The collection of Olmec heads alone are breath taking and I particularly liked the open air/garden settings for some of the displays.
The building is amazing with polished marble and classy displays and considering the quality and importance of the place the lack of crowds is puzzling.
Its a short bus ride from the centre of town although a taxi wouldn't break the bank.
Audio guides are, in theory, available but not when I visited although if you have read up a little before your visit they are not really necessary.
The museum was my, and probably most peoples, reason to visit Xalapa and I was not disappointed.

540895009.name: Stunning & impressive
540895009.author: a TripAdvisor user
540895009.reviewBody: This museum contains the archaeological riches of Vera Cruz , important material from El Tajin.  The museum contains the remarkable La Mojarra Stela this large basalt slab was found sticking out of a Vera Cruz riverbank in 1986 it depicts the standing figure of a ruler with an elaborate Maya - like headdress in the form of a mythological bird.
