The highlight of the museum , in my opinion , is the Olmec sculptures   , magnificent sophisticated works of art.  It is well designed museum , lots of natural light & verdant gardens. There is a bookshop , not many English books on offer when I was there & a small cafe upstairs. This museum is on par with the main museum in Mexico City.

534169767.name: 2nd only to Museo Antropologia CDMX
534169767.author: a TripAdvisor user
534169767.reviewBody: What a treat here in the "Athens" of Mexico.  Beautiful facility, parking nearby, excellent content... worth a day!

506291386.name: Incre\u00edble/Awesome!
506291386.author: a TripAdvisor user
506291386.reviewBody: Este museo no solamente refleja una parte importante del pasado de Veracruz porque muestra importantes piezas de las culturas que ah\u00ed habitaron, sino que la arquitectura del lugar es muy bella. Lo \u00fanico que falt\u00f3 fue que vendieran una gu\u00eda del museo. Estaban agotadas. Fuera de eso, nos encant\u00f3! Vale la pena visitarlo.\n\nThis museum not only reflects an important part of the history of the state of Veracruz because it shows important pieces made by the ancient cultures who lived there, but also it has a beautiful architecture. The only thing missing was museum guides. They were sold out but besides that, we loved it. It\'s worth to visit!

496352969.name: World-Class
496352969.author: a TripAdvisor user
496352969.reviewBody: Great place for Ancient-Mexico history buffs. The displays are excellent and the interior of the museum is impressive. My favorite objects were the colossal heads made by the Olmecas.

484799750.name: Extensive collection of several local cultures.
484799750.author: a TripAdvisor user
484799750.reviewBody: The building itself is an experience.  Some of the exhibits are unlike any I\'ve seen elsewhere.  They are more varied and compelling than I saw in Mexico City.

478606823.name: Amazing place
478606823.author: a TripAdvisor user
478606823.reviewBody: It is a great museum, has the largest collection of huge stone heads from the Olmec time. I love the place, the the gardens, the halls are in great comprehensive display

477839125.name: Absolutely stunning
477839125.author: a TripAdvisor user
477839125.reviewBody: This incredible 30-year-old museum boasts an unrivaled collection of megalithic Olmec heads and other massive sculptures made by that Mesoamerican civilization.  There is nothing like it at Mexico City\'s Anthropological Museum, nor at La Venta in Villahermosa.  The museum also has magnificent examples of exquisite Totonac pieces.  The spacious galleries are very well-curated and allow for uninhibited viewing of these ancient masterpieces.  The museum building is set within a beautifully landscaped park on the outskirts of the city.  If you are within 100 miles of Xalapa you owe it to yourself to visit this world class  site.

474394280.name: Very nice museum
474394280.author: a TripAdvisor user
474394280.reviewBody: Very nice museum, Olmeca and other prehispanic cultures in state of Veracruz. Preferently use a guide.\n

467121541.name: Mesmerising wonder.
467121541.author: a TripAdvisor user
467121541.reviewBody: An intellectual place to wonder around and see the true Mexican culture of the past.  The biggest museum in latin America about the Toltec culture with original pieces of art.

465662650.name: Fascinating museum
465662650.author: a TripAdvisor user
465662650.reviewBody: If you like Mexican history, you\'ll love this museum. Fascinating exhibits featuring artifacts from the Olmecs, including several giant stone heads (cabezas colosales). The signage is in Spanish, so if you can\'t read it, I\'d suggest hiring their English speaking guide, in order to get the most out of your visit. Entry is just 50 pesos, and there\'s a bookstore and little caf\u00e9 inside.

463748146.name: Great museum
463748146.author: a TripAdvisor user
463748146.reviewBody:
Very professional and well laid out museum.  Just the right size for non-museum buffs.  Nice grounds too to walk through when the exhibits are done. 

Not too far from the Centro. 

Artifacts from 1,000 BC!  Really interesting.

463005708.name: Great collection Well presented
463005708.author: a TripAdvisor user
463005708.reviewBody: Thoroughly enjoyable visit in an airy light atmosphere\nA great example of architecture fulfilling purpose \nThe artifacts are spectacular

454163189.name: Amazing
454163189.author: a TripAdvisor user
454163189.reviewBody: Giant Olmec heads and many other peaces from the Tultec, Maya and other civilizations make this museum one not to be missed.  They have English speaking cell phone self-guided tours that make it nice.  The famous wheeled toy is here as are many other sculptures that any student of pre-colombian civilizations will recognize.

447934739.name: A must in Xalapa!
447934739.author: a TripAdvisor user
447934739.reviewBody: As a local in Xalapa, I must say that this is the #1 must site in town. It\'s cheap (like 2USD) and it\'s fabulous! Check the website for days and hours, as it currently closes on Mondays.

446773538.name: Great visit!
446773538.author: a TripAdvisor user
446773538.reviewBody: My kids loved this . The history is amazing in the exhibits. The price was not horrible. There are awesome events that sometimes are going on while at the museum. I would recommend it!

442060273.name: I saw 7 Olmec heads.
442060273.author: a TripAdvisor user
442060273.reviewBody: I drove a rental car from Mexico City 4 hours to El Tajin and then another 4 hours to my hotel in Xalapa near this museum.  I specifically stopped here to see this museum for the Olmec heads and civilization known around Veracruz on the Gulf of Mexico.  This museum was well worth the trip.  If my count is correct, I saw seven 6ft tall colossal heads at this museum.  The signs were not in English but I believe you could rent headphones that gave you English explanations. The interior of the museum is all marble and very nice, and the exterior is a nicely landscaped park area and there is a water fountain in front.  There is also a gift shop with a lot of books.

437831043.name: Amazing must see museum
437831043.author: a TripAdvisor user
437831043.reviewBody: This is an amazing museum. I like it better than the world renown Natural History Museum in Mexico City. The many many antiquities in the museum are wonderfully arranged so that as you walk on the marble floors you can easily see the many special pieces that go back  thousands of years. The Olmec heads are definitely a highlight. They have audio tapes that you can rent to explain many of the pieces. It is truly a must see museum.

425637349.name: Very impressive - don\'t miss it
425637349.author: a TripAdvisor user
425637349.reviewBody: Better than I expected even after I read the reviews. The building itself is worth the visit. The way the buildings descends down the slope in steps is impressive as are the secluded gardens to the side. The contents are amazing and to think they are from the nearby area and mostly so well preserved. On the downside the English audio was very difficult to understand at times. Why go to so much trouble to set up an audio guide and then have a poor speaker. The other thing to watch is the drops in the floor level which are about 70 cm and unprotected.

421025930.name: Way better than expected
421025930.author: a TripAdvisor user
421025930.reviewBody:
We didn't expect much from an athropology museum in what is a pretty small city BUT we were blown away and spent hours there. We paid MX $25 each entry (student prices - they accept UK student cards) and paid an additional MX $50 for an audioguide which turned out to be essential as our Spanish sucks.
There was so much to see and learn about and some really impressive exhibits (you can't miss the colossal heads!) That are from thousands of years ago. Also, the gardens are really well maintained which makes the little walk back up the slope really enjoyable. 

My only tiny critism is of the audioguide which was a little hard to understand as it used Spanish pronunciation of letters in English words (probably just a computer reading it out) but it seriously didn't matter because it was on an ipod type thing so you could just read it instead. Still was worth it because it also had a little map and used QR codes so you could choose which exhibit you listened/read about which was very high tech.

We walked from Xalapa Centro to the museum which took about 35 minutes mostly uphill but you pass some cheap street food vendors for lunch and get to see more of the city. We spent about 2 hours in the museum altogether at a medium-slow pace.  

If you're in Xalapa, I would absolutely give this museum a go and, unless you speak okay Spanish,  get an audioguide.

417581348.name: Perfect place to learn about Olmec culture
417581348.author: a TripAdvisor user
417581348.reviewBody: A world class museum with spacious display of artifacts. A nice place to retreat before venturing into the exploration of nature of Veracruz.

411575037.name: Incredible collection
411575037.author: a TripAdvisor user
411575037.reviewBody: I was surprised by the quality and sheer volume of artifacts, but the variety was unexpected. So much, so many influences... DO NOT MISS THIS! The best museum in a long time.

409080143.name: The Second Best Museum of Mexico
409080143.author: a TripAdvisor user
409080143.reviewBody: A full Museum of excellent pieces, clear explications,  illustrative, wide gardens, a marvelous place... A History Palace!

409053760.name: One of the best museum in latinoamerica
409053760.author: a TripAdvisor user
409053760.reviewBody: The museum houses the largest collection of artifacts from Mexican Gulf Coast cultures such as the Olmec, the Huastec and the Totonac with more than 25,000 pieces. The most notable pieces in the museum are the giant Olmec heads and the smaller Totonac ones, which are called "caritas sonrientes" (little smiling faces) in Spanish. The museum also contains a 40,000-square-meter garden.\n\nSome of the pieces in the museum date back to the Early Pre-Classic Period from 1300 BC to 900 BC.

393211103.name: Outstanding collection in a beautiful venue
393211103.author: a TripAdvisor user
393211103.reviewBody: World class museum housing significant collection documenting pre-Hispanic culture in the region.  Spent a good two hours there.  Grounds are beautiful as well.  Well worth seeing.

387559491.name: This Anthropological  Museum worth Hours to visit
387559491.author: a TripAdvisor user
387559491.reviewBody: This museum is a multi-tiered edifice with many artifacts predating the Castilian Conquest, by sword, gun, disease. If anthropolgy intrigues a person that one will find this place worthy to explore and observe. The only disappointment I found is the souvenir / book store is undersized.  A favorite stop of ours has been the Bolo de Oro coffee houses in Xalapa, sort of like Star Bucks. Coffee is everywhere in this state!  Enjoy a cup before or after a tour of the museum.

375199246.name: Excellent displays of Olmec artifacts
375199246.author: a TripAdvisor user
375199246.reviewBody: We didn\'t have much time so we hired an English-speaking guide. He provided the context to what we were seeing so that it all made sense. At ~800 pesos or around $50, the guide is good for 20 people but still well worth it even for the 3 of us. He was very knowledgeable and answered our questions.

373539552.name: A Must Visit...
373539552.author: a TripAdvisor user
373539552.reviewBody: If you do nothing else in Xalapa, plan to spend a couple of hours at this museum.  This museum lays out the Gulf Coast history of Mexico from the founding of the first cities by the Olmec up to the Conquest of the region by the Spanish.  There are many artifacts that date back as far as 1000 BCE. You will be amazed by the size and detail of the Olmec heads.

369714845.name: Great museum with wonderful landscaping
369714845.author: a TripAdvisor user
369714845.reviewBody: It is laid out well, has good explanations (in Spanish), and a small area with an art exhibit.  The flowers and landscaping are good enough that I took pictures outside as well as in the museum.

367519385.name: Incredible Museum..
367519385.author: a TripAdvisor user
367519385.reviewBody: If I remember they are closed on Sunday and Monday.  If you travel to Xalapa and don\'t spend a minimum of a half a day there, you will be missing out on the best collection from the Olmec civilization.  Mexico City has a better collection of various different civilizations but this is off the chart!!!  I have personally gone five times when friends and family have come to visit and could go any day and still enjoy myself..  It\'s really that good!!

367377502.name: Best Olmec collection in Mexico
367377502.author: a TripAdvisor user
367377502.reviewBody: Xalapa is out of the way, but if you\'re traveling to the East coast of Mexico, it\'s a short bus ride from Vera Cruz. The Xalapa Museum of Archaeology has a deep collection of Meso-American ancient art -- colossal Olmec heads, stone figures, ceramics -- dating back at least 5,000 years, and presented in an informative, well-designed way.\nComfortable walking in an air-conditioned modern building, and even a snack bar!

365006792.name: Don\'t miss it if you visit Xalapa
365006792.author: a TripAdvisor user
365006792.reviewBody: It\'s one of the most beautiful and interesting museum of Mexico. If you come to Xalapa you can\'t miss it.

350093007.name: One of the best in Mexico
350093007.author: a TripAdvisor user
350093007.reviewBody: This museum has over 25,000 artifacts from the main cultures of the region: Olmec, Totonac, Huaxtec and they are very nicely laid out in this huge building. Although the descriptions are in Spanish, I was able to read and understand them. It is great to see this huge collection stay in the area, tho some had been taken out of the country and now exhibited in other museums.

348840142.name: Takes whole day to explore in the museum
348840142.author: a TripAdvisor user
348840142.reviewBody: Well done exhibitions. One of the best museums in the world. It\'s worth every penny (65 pesos). Only minus is that not all the information is in english.

346401517.name: Not to be missed
346401517.author: a TripAdvisor user
346401517.reviewBody: This is a spectacular new museum that holds the oltec and other pre Mayan and pre Aztec culture. Beautifully designed with gardens and displays exhibited down a long stepped hall. Collection is unique and spellbinding. Very easy to spend an afternoon here. We were lucky to have a Spanish guide to show us what was important. He spoke Spanish slowly and gave us incredible insight into what we were looking at. Really made visit special.  Don\'t miss this stunning collection.

346018468.name: Best museum in Veracruz
346018468.author: a TripAdvisor user
346018468.reviewBody: Loved the architecture of the museum, with wide open spaces, lots of natural light, and a big garden which anyone can enjoy with nice weather. The collection is very interesting with beautiful pieces from ancient cultures of the state of Veracruz.

345987960.name: Spellbinding
345987960.author: a TripAdvisor user
345987960.reviewBody: This is a magnificent place to spend an afternoon wandering around in a beautiful building learning about the prehistory of Mexico. Displays gardens and oltec heads are stunning.we had a wonderful guide who spoke Spanish slowly for us but managed to convey the richness of the eras and cultures. Don\'t miss it!

343411823.name: very interesting museum
343411823.author: a TripAdvisor user
343411823.reviewBody: A beautiful collection of pre columbian art. Nice enormous heads from the Olmec culture and very nice statues of the cultures of the Golf region plus a lot of artofacts from oother place.

336082763.name: A  World-class museum!
336082763.author: a TripAdvisor user
336082763.reviewBody: This museum was built on a hill, so that each level is a few feet lower than the previous. Our guide said that it is 1.5 Km in length. Each level has two large rooms, one is a garden with local flora and large archeological pieces. We went with on a group tour that grew progressively large, but was very interesting as many of the participants were very knowledgeable. If I were to do it again I would go for the personalized tour. There are restrooms at both ends of the museum, but none in between. Photographs are allowed, but no flashes. Their staff are knowledgeable, professional and courteous. A must see!

336079224.name: An Amazing Historical Trip
336079224.author: a TripAdvisor user
336079224.reviewBody: This is an outstanding anthropologic museum that focuses on ancient cultures of the state of Veracruz. The Olmec civilization had a complex naturalistic religion, magnificent huge stone head sculptures, a competitive game of pelota and a trip through this museum takes you back to a 1000 B.C to learn about this life.

332283393.name: Amazing pre hispanic collection
332283393.author: a TripAdvisor user
332283393.reviewBody: This museum is the second most important in Mexico. Here you can find a very neatly explanation of the Veracruz pre hispanic cultures that inhabited the different regions.From the colosal olmec heads to a very clear  recreation of the Tajin archeological zone. The visit will take minimun two or three hours, but its so worthy!

329763457.name: A must see!!!
329763457.author: a TripAdvisor user
329763457.reviewBody: This museum is second in importance after the impressive Anthropology Museum in Mexico City. Its prehispanic art collection is of great importance. The building itself is a piece of art. It is a more than enough reason to visit "the flower city".

326689245.name: wonderful museum with an abundance of exhibits
326689245.author: a TripAdvisor user
326689245.reviewBody: This museum is rated 2nd in Mexico only to the larger one in Mexico City and deservedly so.  Beautiful building, well laid out exhibits.  Some rooms are a little dark but accent lighting throughout.  Lovely well kept grounds.  Large theatre at end with a variety of talks or music performances to complement the overall experience.  Bring your ID if a senior as significant discount to what is already a very reasonable entry fee.

325090309.name: Fantastic!
325090309.author: a TripAdvisor user
325090309.reviewBody: A wonderful and special place to visit and get an idea of several cultures that used to live in the Mexican state of Veracruz.

322503091.name: A must destination!
322503091.author: a TripAdvisor user
322503091.reviewBody: This beautiful building houses one of the most spectacular collections of Olmec art and sculptures outside of Mexico City.\nI was totally engrossed for 3 hours.

321885984.name: amazing experience to be so close and up front with the art of Veracruz
321885984.author: a TripAdvisor user
321885984.reviewBody: just amazing. go and spend some time. an excellent experience. easy to find, taxis are incredibly inexpensive in xalapa. the outdoor gardens are lovely.

299800028.name: A world-class museum! Just make sure you read Spanish WELL if you want to know about anything in there.
299800028.author: a TripAdvisor user
299800028.reviewBody: This is a fantastic museum! The anthropology museum in Mexico City is the best I have ever been to, but the Xalapa museum I think is the best possible regional museum. Priceless artifacts are well-organized and grouped into cultural periods, and the architecture is great: you kind of "descend" into history, going downhill (ha) the closer you get to present day. The one reason I\'m giving it 5 stars is that they only have explanations in Spanish. This is of course fine and their right, but this museum is international-quality; so for visitors who don\'t have great Spanish, there\'s not a whole lot they can find out about other than wondering what the artifacts mean. Some of the rooms had laminated placards at the entrances to them, but they simply gave a brief summary of the contents and the period rather than information about specific items.

297574223.name: Excellent Anthropology museum that rivals the National Museum in D.F. for quality!
297574223.author: a TripAdvisor user
297574223.reviewBody: Excellent Anthropology museum that rivals the National Museum in D.F. for quality! \n\nThe exhibits are complete but have only very very nice pieces of sculptures ... very well organized and laid out. Also the gardens on premises and architecture are very nice as well.

294845649.name: Amazing presentation of Veracruz history
294845649.author: a TripAdvisor user
294845649.reviewBody: This museum is considered the second of its kind in Mexico, and deservedly so. It combines a quiet, nature-surrounded setting with a top quality collection of pieces from three different cultures (Olmece, Centre of Veracruz and Huasteca) all of them perfectly preserved.

282245554.name: Nice place to learn about the prehispanic art
282245554.author: a TripAdvisor user
282245554.reviewBody: A very nice museum, well conserved and nice architecture open place and also very nice collection of the prehispanic era.

281860783.name: An incredible display of the mexican culture.
281860783.author: a TripAdvisor user
281860783.reviewBody: I loved the fact of being so close to the exhibition pieces and having at the same time little open-air spaces to relax, enjoy your visit and nature. It is so relaxing and the weather is almost perfect all year round.\n

268391348.name: Fantastic museum!
268391348.author: a TripAdvisor user
268391348.reviewBody: The way the exhibit is set up is wonderful: plants and paths surround some of these majestic ancient sculptures, there are so many interesting artifacts on display, a lovely garden surrounds the building. You can easily spend half a day in the museum. The entrance fee is extremely reasonable.

260426270.name: incredible collection
260426270.author: a TripAdvisor user
260426270.reviewBody: It is the second largest museum in Mexico and has an awesome collection of ancient artifacts including seven of the huge Olmec heads

259776588.name: Great museum, if you speak Spanish
259776588.author: a TripAdvisor user
259776588.reviewBody: This museum is awesome! - but if you don\'t speak/read Spanish, don\'t plan on reading any of the plaques, as they\'re one language only. There might be audio tours in English, but I didn\'t check...in each "room" of the museum there seemed to be some placards with summaries in English. They\'re not required to write everything in English as well, of course, but it\'s a great museum and would be a fantastic addition if they wanted to attract more of an international crowd - of which it is very worthy!

259548640.name: Giant Olmec heads
259548640.author: a TripAdvisor user
259548640.reviewBody: This museum was surprising and wonderful, the Olmec heads alone make it a must see and it\'s in a neighborhood with a fabulous park

255146825.name: Do not miss this museum
255146825.author: a TripAdvisor user
255146825.reviewBody: At first, we thought we would skip this, since we had come from Mexico City and visited the national anthropology museum there. But I\'m glad it was a rainy day, and perfect for spending it indoors at a museum. It is focused on the Olmecs and other ancient cultures of this particular area, so there is a lot more variety here of the Olmec culture than in the national museum. I really loved the famous large heads. It was fun to choose which one "spoke" to me to have my picture taken next to. I also loved the smaller laughing statues, which were placed in burials to assure a happy afterlife. I also chose one that made me smile the most to take a photo of. I actually used this photo on my Christmas card to illustrate my year last year.

255004198.name: Wonderful museum
255004198.author: a TripAdvisor user
255004198.reviewBody: Xalapa museum was brilliant. The scale and the range of items was breathtaking. The items were well placed throughout the museum, following a logical sequence. The museum is also brilliantly lit, which sets everything off to perfection. My favourites were the huge heads, which were most impressive. Our visit was perfect due to our fabulous guide Jaime!\n\nI unreservedly recommend the museum.

254773333.name: A very pleasant museum to visit
254773333.author: a TripAdvisor user
254773333.reviewBody: The museum is laid out like a series of massive stairs that works its way down a gentle hill while passing from one culture or epoch to the next as one moves to the next stair.  There is not a lot of documentation and virtually all text is in Spanish.  The museum is very open and there are gardens along the stairs that have Olmec heads and other large sculptures.  Very well done.  There website said it is open Mondays but that wasn\'t true once i tried.

253896920.name: Great place
253896920.author: a TripAdvisor user
253896920.reviewBody: I really enjoyed the museum. It is the best thing in Xalapa. It is not as good as the one in Mexico City, but it is quite remarkable and worthwhile seeing.

253736467.name: amazing collection
253736467.author: a TripAdvisor user
253736467.reviewBody: We took a taxi here (25 pesos) as it is about 2 miles from the city center.  The building is beautiful (entrance is 50 pesos) and the collection of Olmec heads and other artifacts is great.  We spent 1.5 hours here and it was perfect for a rainy afternoon.  There are nice grounds, front and back, for a sunny day.  The museum was very quiet when we were there.

253698198.name: Outstanding display of pre-hispanic civilizations
253698198.author: a TripAdvisor user
253698198.reviewBody: The architecture of the building is fantastic and promotes the integration with Nature through several gardens with many museum pieces. \nThe huge Olmec heads (cabezas monumentales) are breathtaking. \nI hope to have a chance to visit again and spend more time reading and learning.

252834396.name: Superb
252834396.author: a TripAdvisor user
252834396.reviewBody: Fabulous museum both architecture and installations. One of the best I\'ve ever seen. Easy to understand, not overwhelming.

249020273.name: World Class!!
249020273.author: a TripAdvisor user
249020273.reviewBody: If your even remotely close to Xalapa you have to see this museum.  It covers 7 different cultures with beautiful relics taken from sites all over Mexico.  Having been to virtually every site in the Yucatan, I\'m rarely blown away any more on new sites.  This place was nothing short of outstanding.  From the Olmec heads to pottery nothing is missed and you will see cultural items that aren\'t to be found any place else except Mexico City.  Plan to spend the day.  Between the Museum, the square, the cathedrals, restaurants and coffee houses there is plenty to do and see.

248549930.name: A must see!
248549930.author: a TripAdvisor user
248549930.reviewBody: The signage is only in Spanish so some knowledge of Spanish would be useful... sometimes they have English-speaking tour guides. This museum has an extensive collection of awe-inspiring works including 3000 yr old colossal heads and intricate ceramic figures.

246268432.name: A Museum to see in Xalapa
246268432.author: a TripAdvisor user
246268432.reviewBody: The Anthropology Museum in Xalapa is a magnificent museum, second best after the Mexico Anthropology museum. Great exibits, elegant and well presented. A must to understand the evolution of the founding peoples in the country.  We jhad a very nteresting guide..

244467743.name: Good museum
244467743.author: a TripAdvisor user
244467743.reviewBody: Is quite a good museum that would have been #1 had we not later visited the Anthropology Museum in Mexico City which is world class.  Is definitely worth seeing if you are at all interested in the archaeological findings in this area of Mexico.

242117572.name: Excellent
242117572.author: a TripAdvisor user

240910312.name: Colossal is right!
240910312.author: a TripAdvisor user
240910312.reviewBody: This is a definite must visit site in Xalapa. Exquisite, elegant, simple, extraordinary - all of these and more. Be sure to get the audio guide and enjoy the stroll through time.

230152632.name: Most amazing collection of Olmecs
230152632.author: a TripAdvisor user
230152632.reviewBody: We didn\'t think we would be wowed by visiting this museum after spending time at the big national museum in Mexico City, but wow, were we wrong. It had an amazing collection of the Olmec archeological artifacts that gave such a rich glimpse into the interesting culture. Yes, the huge heads were awesome, but my favorite collection were the laughing dolls. They really were expressive.

221861856.name: Very similar to the museo antropologia
221861856.author: a TripAdvisor user
221861856.reviewBody: Just in case it isn\'t obvious, this is the very same place as the Museo de Antropologia in Xalapa. Tripadvisor has two listings for the place.

221861181.name: Nice, modern museum with some gruesome, ancient exhibits
221861181.author: a TripAdvisor user
221861181.reviewBody: The building is very spacious (high ceilings, big windows, lots of space between exhibits) and contains some fantastic pieces (colossal Olmec heads, statues of gods wearing the inside-out skin of others, etc.). English guides are available and mine told me the tour would take about one and a half to two hours, but it was over two hours and we didn\'t look at absolutely everything. The guide was very informative, so I recommend this option. You can take pictures as long as you don\'t use flash. There\'s also a nice garden, a shop, and (I think) a cafe. It\'s the best way I can think of to learn about ancient Mexican culture. Some of these pieces were shown in Britain a few years ago in an exhibition of Aztec culture. That show was packed. Here in Xalapa there was almost nobody else in the museum, which made for a much better experience.

219679577.name: Need more than one day
219679577.author: a TripAdvisor user
219679577.reviewBody: The first time I went to the Anthroplolgy Museum I had to stop after only seeing half of it. There was so much to take in it was overwhelming to me and I scheduled another day to take the rest in. The artifacts and the manner in which they were displayed were exquisite.  If visiting Xalapa, one must really make some time to visit this magnificent Museum, even if you only get to see part of it.  It will be worth your time!

214733524.name: Grand museum
214733524.author: a TripAdvisor user
214733524.reviewBody: The museum is much bigger than what I expected, displays are very nice, expect almost 3 hours on your visit, my only complaint is the layout is at different levels, as you walk you have to be careful not to fall, since there is no warning or a handrail to prevent you from falling to the next level, and it is a good one meter high. this might occur since we tend to look at the displays as we walk, word of caution, just be careful, otherwise it is very comfortable and well worth the visit.

213110658.name: Mexico City, please copy
213110658.author: a TripAdvisor user
213110658.reviewBody: We spent 5 hours viewing the collection of this museum. Located in lush green surroundings, the museum displays the works in a beautiful setting, providing just the right amount of information for each object, with plenty of space to walk around, sit, take photos and look. Worth visiting Xalapa just for this and the botanical garden.

208937128.name: STELLAR.
208937128.author: a TripAdvisor user
208937128.reviewBody: This museum is superb.  It is one of the finest anthropology museums in Mexico, a country full of museums.  \nMy only real complaint is that they don\'t allow DSLR cameras, only the small pocket digital cameras.

202472401.name: Simply fantastic museum
202472401.author: a TripAdvisor user
202472401.reviewBody: The Anthropology Museum in Xalapa is simply spectacular. Although it is located a bit outside the main town it is well worth the effort. Not only is the building itself a fantastic structure but it has wonderful gardens and even more impressive archeological holdings. Be prepared for a visit of 2-3 hours I would say! I think more than anything I was impressed by the relationship between the design of the building and the exhibits. The building flows downhill rather like a waterfall and at each level one encounters cultural riches that simply take your breath away. Perhaps the most spectacular are the giant heads but there is so much here to engage with. I would say at least two visits are need to really appreciate what is on offer.

202333497.name: Worlds Heritage, Unique Aztec & Mayan Collection !
202333497.author: a TripAdvisor user
202333497.reviewBody: This museum was built in the 60s, amazing architecture holds World best Aztec and Mayan collections.  The original Stone Aztec calendar is one of the highlights as well as the Big Toltec Heads.  Just Amazing !!!!!!

202327987.name: Amazing
202327987.author: a TripAdvisor user
202327987.reviewBody: I had read and been told how good this museum was so I had to visit.  It\'s a little bit out of the centre but its easy to get a bus, and my bus driver showed me where to get off.  The exhibits are awe inspiring (showing excellent examples of all pre-Hispanic cultures), the layout is excellent, and the setting is beautiful.  I spent about 3hrs having a good look around.  M$50 entry, you must got if you are anywhere near Xalapa.

201330272.name: One of the best museums in North America
201330272.author: a TripAdvisor user
201330272.reviewBody: Since I have lived in Xalapa for the last 42 years, I remember what the Anthropology Museum was like about 25 years ago. The display rooms where similar to the metal grain silos of western Kansas where I grew up. The lighting was terrible, just everything was terrible. But today\'s museum rivals of the worlds best in content and museography. Do not miss the opportunity of at least a 3 or 4 hour visit to see part of the incredible artifacts presented in this outstanding architectural masterpiece. I have literally been to the museum dozens of times, and each time I go I encounter something "new" and different.

198414110.name: World Class Museum in Xalapa
198414110.author: a TripAdvisor user
198414110.reviewBody: The Museo de Antropologia in Xalapa is a magnificent facility to house a magnificent collection of the very best of the prehispanic Gulf Coast cultures of the Olmecs, Totonacs and Huastecs. Built on a slopg hill, ten terrace levels begin at the top with Olmec colossal heads and othr large sculptures, then descend through the later cultures and their very best artifcacts and sculptures. There is a great bookstore that also sells acceptable replicas of some of the ceramic artifacts. This museum alone is worth a trip to Xalapa (also spelled Jalapa).

193601888.name: Museo de Antropolog\u00eda, Xalapa
193601888.author: a TripAdvisor user
193601888.reviewBody: If you are interested in the pre-conquest history of Mexico or in appreciating good museum design, Xalapa\'s Museo de Antropolog\u00eda--the MAX--is an unsurpassed destination and easily one of the best anthropological museums in the Western hemisphere.  The museum itself is beautiful and functional, and the quality of the art and artifacts, especially from the Mexican Gulf coast area, is excellent.  Labels and descriptions are in Spanish, but there is some information in English--the audio guide is probably the way to go if you do not read Spanish.  When you go, make sure you block at least three hours for a cursory look at the museum\'s contents.  The bookstore (said to be very good) closes before the museum does.

193004019.name: Best Possible Place to Learn About Preconquest Veracruz Cultures
193004019.author: a TripAdvisor user
193004019.reviewBody: Beautiful museum, highly informative; ask for the audio guide in English if your Spanish reading skills are not developed.

191846751.name: Great Museum
191846751.author: a TripAdvisor user
191846751.reviewBody: The attractive museum has the best exhibits for anthropology of the Gulf Coast of Mexico.  Get the English audio guide.

189664503.name: Second only to the Museum of Anthropology in Mexico City
189664503.author: a TripAdvisor user
189664503.reviewBody: Great museum and wonderful architecture. Most of the inscriptions were in Spanish but we discovered the there were English info sheets on the wall at the entrance to each room which gave an introduction to what you would find there.

185012320.name: Excellent museum
185012320.author: a TripAdvisor user
185012320.reviewBody: We opted to visit the Xalapa Museum of Anthropology rather than Mexico City\'s because of the amount of time we would have. This museum does an excellent job of telling many stories in a clear and concise manner. Excellent artifacts. We did buy a guide book in the museum bookstore for about $10 since nothing is interpreted in English.

183696355.name: A True Lesson in History
183696355.author: a TripAdvisor user
183696355.reviewBody: The entire experience was great. Very inexpensive admission and lovely building. English headphones for self guided tour. Make sure to check out the gift shop and sit and rest with a fresh Espresso.

182728562.name: A WALK THROUGH INDIGENOUS HISTORY
182728562.author: a TripAdvisor user
182728562.reviewBody: The region of Veracruz is a very historic region but it was define by its indigenous culture before its colonization by the Spanish.  Find out about the indigenous tribes and their organizational hierarchy here at the Anthropology Museum. The Museum is not in the center part of the city, so therefore, you will need a taxi if you are coming from central for the cost of 50 MXN pesos (less than $5). The entrance fee is also 50 MXN pesos but be advised that the journey through Veracruz Indigenous history is long ( about 3 hours). No flash photos are allowed for regular patrons unless you pay a professional fee to do so. I found the museum very interesting and took many photos. However, I was very hungry afterwards, so I could recommend  Pollo Feliz across the street for lunch because the food and atmosphere are excellent there.

174344734.name: A great insight into the history of Mexico
174344734.author: a TripAdvisor user
174344734.reviewBody: Located near the centre of the city is the beautiful museum of Anthropology. For the low price of 25 pesos (about 1.50gbp) you get to explore many different eras of Mexican architecture and artifacts. There is a beautiful large garden available to break up the different sections. There is a great cafe that sells fresh coffee and cake and also a high-end restaurant if you wish to dine. The shop has an abundance of books and trinkets to take home. An extremely pleasant day out in Xalapa.

165051483.name: Outstanding Museum with exquisite ancient artifacts
165051483.author: a TripAdvisor user
165051483.reviewBody: If you are visiting this region this museum is not to be missed! It is the second largest collection of pre-hispanic art after the Museum of Anthropology in Mexico City. However, this museum covers more ancient works. The Museum is a soothingly modern design. Be sure to get headsets or a guide.

164897562.name: Outstanding museum
164897562.author: a TripAdvisor user
164897562.reviewBody: We only had a little over an hour so we were rushed, but it was such a great museum and we were were able to see it all, though we would have liked more time. The presentation was fantastic, and the Olmec heads are amazing. Even the small sculptures are so well displayed and lit that you see the details. I love the smiling statues!

158894016.name: great introduction to olmeca and related coastal mesoamerica
158894016.author: a TripAdvisor user
158894016.reviewBody: very well laid out and captions were excellent in spanish.  spent 4 hours here with our group of museum guides from national hispanic cultural center in albuquerque as one of our focal points for the trip...as a member of the american museum alliance i can say this is an outstanding museum well worth the time even if you don\'t have spanish as the dates are self explanatory and the huastecan and nahuatl cultures that followd the olmec is not often seen in us exhibits, but they were connected with the puble culture of the rio grand valley and the mississippian cultures of the cahoka mounds in illinois

151577116.name: A great place
151577116.author: a TripAdvisor user
151577116.reviewBody: I can easily get museumed out but this one kept my interest.  It was truly amazing.  Even the architecture of the building was interesting.  We loved it.

149763639.name: Amazing museum
149763639.author: a TripAdvisor user
149763639.reviewBody: Everyone we know that has visited this museum has raved about it and, for this reason, we visited Xalapa.  The museum way exceeded our expectations.  The artifacts are beautifully displayed and explained.  The gardens are exceptional.  \n\nWe were very pleased to have rented the audio guide; it added a lot to the experience.

148660331.name: Getting keys to understand Totonacas\' culture
148660331.author: a TripAdvisor user
148660331.reviewBody: I liked the exceptional content on Totonacas collections, the superb museography with plants, the great architecture.

146490167.name: Best Archeoogical Museum in Mexico
146490167.author: a TripAdvisor user
146490167.reviewBody: Beautiful building and grounds, excellent artifacts displayed chronologically, not as exhausting as Mexico City museum, uncrowded in delightful park

143880415.name: Excellent items, poor labels (Cosas excellente, descripciones pobres)
143880415.author: a TripAdvisor user
143880415.reviewBody: I love the exhibit, garden & antiquities, but the labels were very poor.  While My Spanish is poor to fair, I could muddle my way through most of the labels.  Most were just descriptive with little to no interpretations, or explanations.  A museum of this magnitude could afford English labels and more accademically satisfying notes on the displays.  Minus 1 star for the labels or lack of books.  The cards at the entrances are NOT sufficient.\nNone-the-less, if you\'re within a days trip to Xalapa, it\'s worth a visit.  We came from Houston to see primarily the museum and other Xalapa surrounds.

143742562.name: Impressive museum
143742562.author: a TripAdvisor user
143742562.reviewBody: This is definitely worth a visit - a lovely modern museum with some unusual exhibits including some structures located in garden areas.

142032566.name: A superb example of how a museum should be
142032566.author: a TripAdvisor user
142032566.reviewBody:
The cost of admission is very low (50 pesos) despite the quantity and quality of the remarkable ancient artefacts housed in this museum which in turn is set within a large and very pleasant garden. There are usually very few people there, allowing you time to really admire the artefacts. There is logic as to how the exhibits are displayed, essentially you are taking a walk through time. The exhibits are all well labelled with brief details, but are all in Spanish (however English audio guides are available at reception), which severely tested my limited vocabulary! 
It is spacious, clean, tidy and well lit. Staff are friendly and helpful.
There is a gift shop and a coffee shop upstairs for refreshments.

The only potential drawback, is that once again, as with many places in México, parking is at a premium, but taxis are relatively inexpensive here and would perhaps be a better option to take. All in all, this is a must see while in Xalapa. If it's good enough for Prince Charles to visit then it is good enough for me!
 (see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/americas/1860506.stm)

139431292.name: Exceelent
139431292.author: a TripAdvisor user
139431292.reviewBody: Excellent!!! This museum has so many items. It concetrates on the Olmec culture and it is comprehansive. it is very well orginized and the display are so interesting. It is recommended to take the audio guide. If you are in Xalapa it is a must.

137257475.name: A must see
137257475.author: a TripAdvisor user
137257475.reviewBody: The museum is a must-go because of the incredible Olmec \'heads\' and other pre-Columbian sculpture work on display. It offers pieces you\'ll see nearly nowhere else. The museum is well build but could do with a refurbishment, then again, it never as crowded as the Museum de Antropologia in Mexico-City. A must see!

135819512.name: Very Interesting, loads to see and take in
135819512.author: a TripAdvisor user
135819512.reviewBody:
There is so much to see in this museum, so if you're interested in Mexican history, it's an absolute must! They keep it varied too by having large reproductions in the grounds of temples, and inside they even a huge section of how the pyramids of Teotihuacan would have looked like when painted. 

There are also a lot of artefacts, and it spans across a huge amount of history. They break it up into sections so if you're more keen to see certain eras you can go there first.

The only problem is that everything's in Spanish, so it's better to either know a bit of Spanish (or have someone with you who does), or be content with just looking. 

Also, for the most part it's wheelchair friendly, and the person in a wheelchair can go in for free.

132436351.name: A not-too missed treat
132436351.author: a TripAdvisor user
132436351.reviewBody: The museum is a must-go because of the incredible Olmec \'heads\' and other pre-Columbian sculpture work on display. It offers pieces you\'ll see nearly nowhere else. The museum is well build but could do with a refurbishment, then again, it never as crowded as the Museum de Antropologia in Mexico-City. A must see!

130600438.name: Spectacular visit
130600438.author: a TripAdvisor user
130600438.reviewBody: If you have any interest at all in the ancient cultures of the Americas you can\'t miss this. Beautiful building, well laid out and very informative. I\'m not a museum person but I wish I had more time to pass here.

127665050.name: don\'t miss it
127665050.author: a TripAdvisor user
127665050.reviewBody: it\'s like a smaller, newer version of Mexico City\'s justly famous Museum Nacional de Antropologia; a beautiful building of stone and marble, set in lush grounds, with an attractive blend of trees, plants and architecture; well-laid out exhibits of Gulf coast archaeology, from the Olmec down to the late Postclassic (Aztecs etc); worth a visit for the Olmec heads along.

124615546.name: Never tired of it
124615546.author: a TripAdvisor user
124615546.reviewBody: The museum layout and the surrounding gardens are among the most attractive in the world. The curators have done a great job providing details and commentaries on the displays. Unlike in many other museums, photos are permitted and the personnel eagerly responds to enquiries.

124531667.name: A Great Place to Understand Veracruz\' History
124531667.author: a TripAdvisor user
124531667.reviewBody: This magnificent museum has the best collection of "Cabezas Olmecas" (huge heads made of stone) dated at the olmec culture period. Some of the stone heads have been lended to several international museums. Also, in the huge archeological collection, there are several jade stone sculptures which show us the richness of the region and the ability of the olmecs to elaborate sculptures..

123675577.name: Don\'t miss this museum!
123675577.author: a TripAdvisor user
123675577.reviewBody: The museum building itself is worth the visit.  Between exhibit halls are beautifully-planted patios where you can take breaks in order to avoid "museum fatigue."  Even if you can\'t absorb all of the information about the various cultures of Veracruz, the museum is wonderful as a sculpture museum.  You don\'t have to know what you\'re looking at to appreciate and enjoy it.  Although I haven\'t tried one yet, I know there are audio guides available in several languages.  Don\'t miss this incredible museum, one of the best in the world!

122609592.name: Best museum visit in a decade!
122609592.author: a TripAdvisor user
122609592.reviewBody: Optional headsets with tour dialogue were a must. But, this museum is a must-see. Extensive selection, thoughtfully displayed, in a stunning building. And don\'t skip the garden stroll when you\'re finished. cafeteria is nothing special though. But you expect that in a museum.

121083513.name: Informative and visually stunning
121083513.author: a TripAdvisor user
121083513.reviewBody: This museum has a collection of artifacts from the prehispanic cultures of this area, including several gigantic Olmec head, as well as other monolithic sculptures, sculptures, stelae and murals from elsewhere in Veracruz. The museum is well set out, and although the written in formation is in Spanish, audioguides in English can be rented.\n\nThis museum is well worth a visit if you are in Xalapa, and Xalapa is a beautiful city that is worth visiting if you can

120642704.name: A beautiful museum, the jewel of Xalapa
120642704.author: a TripAdvisor user
120642704.reviewBody: Far from the center but easy to find on avenida Xalapa, it is a long and spacious museum, well lit with some rooms organized in open-air patios. Many giant Olmec heads and a few smaller pieces that are very interesting.\nYou can also see remains from a colorful temple that have been transferred to the museum for conservation purposes.

116400530.name: An amazing collection located in its own outstanding building and gardens.
116400530.author: a TripAdvisor user
116400530.reviewBody: A stunning collection detailing the many great cultures of this area. The purpose built building with its long descending galleries shows the artifacts off beautifully. And the links to the garden create another very pleasant dimension. \nWe hired audio guides in English for M20 pesos.  Great value.

89382587.name: If you are in Xalapa don\'t miss this museum
89382587.author: a TripAdvisor user
89382587.reviewBody:
This truly is a magnificent museum. It's devoted to the artifacts found from the ancient indigenous people from this area of Mexico. I have read that only the anthropology  museum in Mexico City is better. Of course, the gigantic Olmec heads are the prize of the museum, including one right in the large entry area,  but there is much more to see. 
First, how to get there. Assuming you are downtown just find a bus stop on Enriquez (on the Cathedral side of the street) which is the main drag that goes through the center of  town or along its extension since the name changes to Camacho  a block after passing the Cathedral. Catch a bus that says Tesoreria. You will go through a nice part of town and pass the new theatre and reach the museum after going about four KMs. 
The museum is hard to miss since it is a very large modern building with gardens and woods next to it. You do pay about 50 pesos to get in. Somehow, despite being in our 60s, the guard sold us half price student tickets. Hmmm? 
The museum is divided into several very large rooms and arranged all in a row so that you have to walk through all of them. As you walk through the museum it is arranged chronologically and the first rooms you are in deal with the Olmecs. The heads are terrific to see and stand next to. Another extra feature in some of the rooms is the vegetation which gives you a feeling of being outside. Although the language used in the museum is obviously Spanish there are laminated descriptive sheets in each room in English too. Some of the rooms have open doors to the outside garden area. After walking the entire length of the museum and seeing themost recent artifacts you will find a bathroom and then you can either walk back through all the rooms again or step outside and walk back on a walkway next to the building or walk through the garden area. Much of the flowering parts of the garden are right next to the walkway. 
Once back in the main entry area you will find a nice shop with books, postcards, CDs, and more and a very small cafe as well. There was also a room with modern art whjich we assumed was a temporary collection. The bus stop is right next to where you got off the bus to get there although the one we caught took us back on a slightly different route.

83171803.name: A GREAT MUSEUM
83171803.author: a TripAdvisor user
83171803.reviewBody:
The second largest anthropology museum in Mexico, and one of the most impressive when you see “the big heads”, belonged  to olmec culture.
Xalapa (capital of Veracruz state ) is a beautiful colonial city, surrounded by amazing mountains, and rivers.
Peaceful, good people, good prices, good food, and a lot of cultural activities.
Really worth stay 3 night at least.

80996379.name: Fantastic museum!
80996379.author: a TripAdvisor user
80996379.reviewBody: We have been to the anthropology museum twice and absolutely love it! Its well planned and organized, and the sculptures and findings in that museum are absolutely gorgeous! I especially like the jungle rooms where they keep some of the stuff, makes it feel more like the way it used to be and less like a museum. Beautiful building, and very agreeable price as we are students and payed 25 pesos to get in. My favourite museum so far, could absolutely see myself just storlling around and reading all the interesting facts and checking out all the history that that museum contains. Very much worth a visit!

36186253.name: M.A.X.: A Side Trip that Should Have Been an Excursion
36186253.author: a TripAdvisor user
36186253.reviewBody:
My wife and I love archaeology and meso-American culture, so we were surprized how little publicized the Museo de Antropologia de Xalapa is.  In years of reading and visiting Mexico it practically took a dig through literature to learn of the existence of this museum.  Even now, MAX has had no reviews here or at a number of other savvy sites.

Having heard of MAX through an article about the city of Xalapa, we made it the focus of 
a recent visit to Mexico, where we wound up at Veracruz because it is more convenient city to reach, more accommodating with vacation hotels on the coast, and more varied due to its size and economy.  (Also, that city offered wonderful access to El Tajin and other intriguing sites.)

We scheduled a trip the Xalapa with the museum as our primary target and thought a day would do.  We had severely underestimated.

Even though the building was undergoing a redesign of most of its exhibit rooms, and with more than half the artifacts unavailable to view, we still had to hurry and often only glimpsing rather than examining individual objects to save tiime in order to see those that were on view.

There was a preponderance of Olmec, Huastec, Zapotec and so called Veracruz work as well as Aztec artifacts.  All this is based on the items visible in the corridors and patio rooms.  The main halls, as noted, were not accessible.

For casual viewers, there are delightful alcoves with statuary, flowers and places to have a seat.  And there are lovely grounds around the museum where children with even shorter attention spans can play.

Topping everything off, the gift shop had some wonderful clothing, magnets, toys, jewelery and a wide variety of books and music.

It's a dazzling place to visit, but avoid our mistake if you can and schedule an overnight stay so you can devote most of the day to MAX and have ample time left to see the rest of the town.
